chunk_text: (1) This Act may be called the Motor Vehicles Act, 1988.
title: Short title, extent and commencement

chunk_text: (2) It extends to the whole of India.
title: Short title, extent and commencement

chunk_text: (3) It shall come into force on such date1 as the Central Government may, by notification in the Official Gazette, appoint; and different dates may be appointed for different State and any reference in this Act to the commencement of this Act shall, in relation to a States, be construed as a reference to the coming into force of this Act in that State.
title: Short title, extent and commencement

chunk_text: In this Act, unless context otherwise requires,--
title: Definitions

chunk_text: 1[(1) "adapted vehicle" means a motor vehicle either specially designed and constructed, or to which alterations have been made under sub-section (2) of section 52, for the use of a person suffering from any physical defect or disability, and used solely by or for such person;
title: Definitions

chunk_text: (1A) "aggregator" means a digital intermediary or market place for a passenger to connect with a driver for the purpose of transportation;
title: Definitions

chunk_text: (1B) "area", in relation to any provision of this Act, means such area as the State Government may, having regard to the requirements of that provision, specify by notification in the Official Gazette;]
title: Definitions

chunk_text: (2) "articulated vehicle" means a motor vehicle to which a semitrailer is attached;
title: Definitions

chunk_text: (3) "axle weight" means in relation to an axle of a vehicle the total weight transmitted by the several wheels attached to that axle to the surface on which the vehicle rests;
title: Definitions

chunk_text: (4) "certificate of registration" means the certificate issued by a competent authority to the effect that a motor vehicle has been duly registered in accordance with the provisions of Chapter IV;
title: Definitions

chunk_text: 2[(4A) "community service" means an unpaid work which a person is required to perform as a punishment for an offence committed under this Act;]
title: Definitions

chunk_text: (5) "conductor", in relation to a stage carriage, means a person engaged in collecting fares from passengers, regulating their entrance into, or exit from, the stage carriage and performing such other functions as may be prescribed;
title: Definitions

chunk_text: (6) "conductor's licence" means the licence issued by a competent authority under Chapter III authorising the person specified therein to act as a conductor;
title: Definitions

chunk_text: (7) "contract carriage" means a motor vehicle which carries a passenger or passengers for hire or reward and is engaged under a contract, whether expressed or implied, for the use of such vehicle as a whole for the carriage of passengers mentioned therein and entered into by a person with a holder of a permit in relation to such vehicle or any person authorised by him in this behalf on a fixed or an agreed rate or sum--
title: Definitions

chunk_text: (a) on a time basis, whether or not with reference to any route or distance; or
title: Definitions

chunk_text: (b) from one point to another, and in either case, without stopping to pick up or set down passengers not included in the contract anywhere during the journey, and includes--
title: Definitions

chunk_text: (i) a maxicab; and
title: Definitions

chunk_text: (ii) a motor cab notwithstanding that separate fares are charged for its passengers;
title: Definitions

chunk_text: (8) "dealer" includes a person who is engaged--
title: Definitions
Definitions

chunk_text: (b) in building bodies for attachment to chassis; or
title: Definitions

chunk_text: (c) in the repair of motor vehicles; or
title: Definitions

chunk_text: (d) in the business of hypothecation, leasing or hire-purchase of motor vehicle;
title: Definitions

chunk_text: (9) "driver" includes, in relation to a motor vehicle which is drawn by another motor vehicle, the person who acts as a steersman of the drawn vehicle;
title: Definitions

chunk_text: 4[(9A) "driver refresher training course" means the course referred to in sub-section (2A) of section 19;]
title: Definitions

chunk_text: (10) "driving licence" means the licence issued by a competent authority under Chapter II authorising the person specified therein to drive, otherwise than as a learner, a motor vehicle or a motor vehicle of any specified class or description;
title: Definitions

chunk_text: (11) "educational institution bus" means an omnibus, which is owned by a college, school or other educational institution and used solely for the purpose of transporting students or staff of the educational institution in connection with any of its activities;
title: Definitions

chunk_text: (12) "fares" includes sums payable for a season ticket or in respect of the hire of a contract carriage;
title: Definitions

chunk_text: 4[(12A) "golden hour" means the time period lasting one hour following a traumatic injury during which there is highest likelihood of preventing death by providing prompt medical care;]
title: Definitions

chunk_text: (13) "goods" includes live-stock, and anything (other than equipment ordinarily used with the vehicle) carried by a vehicle except living persons, but does not include luggage or personal effects carried in a motor car or in a trailer attached to a motor car or the personal luggage of passengers travelling in the vehicle;
title: Definitions

chunk_text: (14) "goods carriage" means any motor vehicle constructed or adapted for use solely for the carriage of goods, or any motor vehicle not so constructed or adapted when used for the carriage of goods;
title: Definitions

chunk_text: (15) "gross vehicle weight" means in respect of any vehicle the total weight of the vehicle and load certified and registered by the registering authority as permissible for that vehicle;
title: Definitions

chunk_text: (16) "heavy goods vehicle" means any goods carriage the gross vehicle weight of which, or a tractor or a road-roller the unladen weight of either of which, exceeds 12,000 kilograms;
title: Definitions

chunk_text: (17) "heavy passenger motor vehicle" means any public service vehicle or private service vehicle or educational institution bus or omnibus the gross vehicle weight of any of which, or a motor car the unladen weight of which, exceeds 12,000 kilograms;
title: Definitions
Definitions

chunk_text: (19) "learner's licence" means the licence issued by a competent authority under Chapter II authorising the person specified therein to drive as a learner, a motor vehicle or a motor vehicle of any specified class or description;
title: Definitions

chunk_text: (20) "licensing authority" means an authority empowered to issue licences under Chapter II or, as the case may be, Chapter III;
title: Definitions

chunk_text: (21) "light motor vehicle" means a transport vehicle or omnibus the gross vehicle weight of either of which or a motor car or tractor or road-roller the unladen weight of any of which, does not exceed 6[7500] kilograms;
title: Definitions

chunk_text: 7[(21A) "manufacturer" means a person who is engaged in the manufacture of motor vehicles;]
title: Definitions

chunk_text: (22) "maxicab" means any motor vehicle constructed or adapted to carry more than six passengers, but not more than twelve passengers, excluding the driver, for hire or reward;
title: Definitions

chunk_text: (23) "medium goods vehicle" means any goods carriage other than a light motor vehicle or a heavy goods vehicle;
title: Definitions

chunk_text: (24) "medium passenger motor vehicle" means any public service vehicle or private service vehicle, or educational institution bus other than a motor cycle, 8[adapted vehicle], light motor vehicle or heavy passenger motor vehicle;
title: Definitions

chunk_text: (25) "motorcab" means any motor vehicle constructed or adapted to carry not more than six passengers excluding the driver for hire or reward;
title: Definitions

chunk_text: (26) "motor car" means any motor vehicle other than a transport vehicle, omnibus, road-roller, tractor, motor cycle or 8[adapted carriage];
title: Definitions

chunk_text: (27) "motor cycle" means a two-wheeled motor vehicle, inclusive of any detachable side-car having an extra wheel, attached to the motor vehicle;
title: Definitions

chunk_text: (28) "motor vehicle" or "vehicle" means any mechanically propelled vehicle adapted for use upon roads whether the power of propulsion is transmitted thereto from an external or internal source and includes a chassis to which a body has not been attached and a trailer; but does not include a vehicle running upon fixed rails or a vehicle of a special type adapted for use only in a factory or in any other enclosed premises or a vehicle having less than four wheels fitted with engine capacity of not exceeding 9[twenty-five cubic centimetres];
title: Definitions

chunk_text: (29) "omnibus" means any motor vehicle constructed or adapted to carry more than six persons excluding the driver;
title: Definitions

chunk_text: (30) "owner" means a person in whose name a motor vehicle stands registered, and where such person is a minor, the guardian of such minor, and in relation to a motor vehicle which is the subject of a hire-purchase, agreement, or an agreement of lease or an agreement of hypothecation, the person in possession of the vehicle under that agreement;
title: Definitions

chunk_text: (31) "permit" means a permit issued by a State or Regional Transport Authority or an authority prescribed in this behalf under this Act authorising the use of a motor vehicle as a transport vehicle;
title: Definitions

chunk_text: (32) "prescribed" means prescribed by rules made under this Act;
title: Definitions

chunk_text: (33) "private service vehicle" means a motor vehicle constructed or adapted to carry more than six persons excluding the driver and ordinarily used by or on behalf of the owner of such vehicle for the purpose of carrying persons for, or in connection with, his trade or business otherwise than for hire or reward but does not include a motor vehicle used for public purposes;
title: Definitions

chunk_text: (34) "public place" means a road, street, way or other place, whether a thoroughfare or not, to which the public have a right of access, and includes any place or stand at which passengers are picked up or set down by a stage carriage;
title: Definitions

chunk_text: (35) "public service vehicle" means any motor vehicle used or adapted to be used for the carriage of passengers for hire or reward, and includes a maxicab, a motorcab, contract carriage, and stage carriage;
title: Definitions

chunk_text: (36) "registered axle weight" means in respect of the axle of any vehicle, the axle weight certified and registered by the registering authority as permissible for that axle;
title: Definitions

chunk_text: (37) "registering authority" means an authority empowered to register motor vehicles under Chapter IV;
title: Definitions

chunk_text: (38) "route" means a line of travel which specifies the highway which may be traversed by a motor vehicle between one terminus and another;
title: Definitions

chunk_text: 10[(38A) "scheme" means a scheme framed under this Act;]
title: Definitions

chunk_text: 11[(39) "semi-trailer" means a vehicle not mechanically propelled (other than a trailer), which is intended to be connected to a motor vehicle and which is so constructed that a portion of it is superimposed on, and a part of whose weight is borne by, that motor vehicle;]
title: Definitions

chunk_text: (40) "stage carriage" means a motor vehicle constructed or adapted to carry more than six passengers excluding the driver for hire or reward at separate fares paid by or for individual passengers, either for the whole journey or for stages of the journey;
title: Definitions

chunk_text: (41) "State Government" in relation to a Union territory means the Administrator thereof appointed under article 239 of the Constitution;
title: Definitions

chunk_text: (42) "State transport undertaking" means any undertaking providing road transport service, where such undertaking is carried on by,--
title: Definitions

chunk_text: (i) the Central Government or a State Government;
title: Definitions

chunk_text: (ii) any Road Transport Corporation established under section 3 of the Road Transport Corporations Act, 1950 (64 of 1950);
title: Definitions

chunk_text: (iii) any municipality or any corporation or company owned or controlled by the Central Government or one or more State Governments, or by the Central Government and one or more State Governments;
title: Definitions

chunk_text: 12[(iv) Zilla Parishad or any other similar local authority.]
title: Definitions

chunk_text: Explanation.--For the purposes of this clause, "road transport service" means a service of motor vehicles carrying passengers or goods or both by road for hire or reward;
title: Definitions

chunk_text: 10[(42A) "testing agency" means any entity designated as a testing agency under section 110B;]
title: Definitions

chunk_text: (43) "tourist vehicle" means a contract carriage constructed or adapted and equipped and maintained in accordance with such specifications as may be prescribed in this behalf;
title: Definitions

chunk_text: (44) "tractor" means a motor vehicle which is not itself constructed to carry any load (other than equipment used for the purpose of propulsion); but excludes a road-roller;
title: Definitions

chunk_text: (45) "traffic signs" includes all signals, warning sign posts, direction posts, markings on the road or other devices for the information, guidance or direction of drivers of motor vehicles;
title: Definitions

chunk_text: (46) "trailer" means any vehicle, other than a semi-trailer and a side-car, drawn or intended to be drawn by a motor vehicle;
title: Definitions

chunk_text: (47) "transport vehicle" means a public service vehicle, a goods carriage, an educational institution bus or a private service vehicle;
title: Definitions

chunk_text: (48) "unladen weight" means the weight of a vehicle or trailer including all equipment ordinarily used with the vehicle or trailer when working, but excluding the weight of a driver or attendant; and where alternative parts or bodies are used the unladen weight of the vehicle means the weight of the vehicle with the heaviest such alternative part or body;
title: Definitions

chunk_text: (49) "weight" means the total weight transmitted for the time being by the wheels of a vehicle to the surface on which the vehicle rests 10[or moves].
title: Definitions

chunk_text: 1[2A. e-cart and e-rickshaw.--(1) Save as otherwise provided in the proviso to sub-section (1) of section 7 and sub-section (10) of section 9, the provisions of this Act shall apply to e-cart and e-rickshaw.
title: e-cart and e-rickshaw

chunk_text: (2) For the purposes of this section, "e-cart or e-rickshaw" means a special purpose battery powered vehicle of power not exceeding 4000 watts, having three wheels for carrying goods or passengers, as the case may be, for hire or reward, manufactured, constructed or adapted, equipped and maintained in accordance with such specifications, as may be prescribed in this behalf.]
title: e-cart and e-rickshaw

chunk_text: 1[2B.Promotion of innovation.-- Notwithstanding anything contained in this Act and subject to such conditions as may be prescribed by the Central Government, in order to promote innovation, research and development in the fields of vehicular engineering, mechanically propelled vehicles and transportation in general, the Central Government may exempt certain types of mechanically propelled vehicles from the application of the provisions of this Act.]
title: Promotion of innovation

chunk_text: (1) No person shall drive a motor vehicle in any public place unless he holds an effective driving licence issued to him authorising him to drive the vehicle; and no person shall so drive a transport vehicle [other than 1[a motor cab or motor cycle] hired for his own use or rented under any scheme made under sub-section (2) of section 75] unless his driving licence specifically entitles him so to do.
title: Necessity for driving licence

chunk_text: (2) The conditions subject to which sub-section (1) shall not apply to a person receiving instructions in driving a motor vehicle shall be such as may be prescribed by the Central Government.
title: Necessity for driving licence

chunk_text: (1) No person under the age of eighteen years shall drive a motor vehicle in any public place:
title: Age limit in connection with driving of motor vehicles

chunk_text: Provided that 1[a motor cycle with engine capacity not exceeding 50cc] may be driven in a public place by a person after attaining the age of sixteen years.
title: Age limit in connection with driving of motor vehicles

chunk_text: (2) Subject to the provisions of section 18, no person under the age of twenty years shall drive a transport vehicle in any public place.
title: Age limit in connection with driving of motor vehicles

chunk_text: (3) No learners licence or driving licence shall be issued to any person to drive a vehicle of the class to which he has made an application unless he is eligible to drive that class of vehicle under this section.
title: Age limit in connection with driving of motor vehicles

chunk_text: No owner or person in charge of a motor vehicle shall cause or permit any person who does not satisfy the provisions of section 3 or section 4 to drive the vehicle.
title: Responsibility of owners of motor vehicles for contravention of sections 3 and 4

chunk_text: (1) No person shall, while he holds any driving licence for the time being in force, hold any other driving licence except a learner’s licence or a driving licence issued in accordance with the provisions of section 18 or a document authorising, in accordance with the rules made under section 139, the person specified therein to drive a motor vehicle.
title: Restrictions on the holding of driving licences

chunk_text: (2) No holder of a driving licence or a learner’s licence shall permit it to be used by any other person.
title: Restrictions on the holding of driving licences

chunk_text: (3) Nothing in this section shall prevent a licensing authority having the jurisdiction referred to in sub-section (1) of section 9 from adding to the classes of vehicles which the driving licence authorises the holder to drive.
title: Restrictions on the holding of driving licences

chunk_text: 1[(1) No person shall be granted a learner's licence to drive a transport vehicle unless he has held a driving licence to drive a light motor vehicle for at least one year:]
title: Restrictions on the granting of learner's licences for certain vehicles

chunk_text: 2[Provided that nothing contained in this sub-section shall apply to an e-cart or e-rickshaw.]
title: Restrictions on the granting of learner's licences for certain vehicles

chunk_text: (2) No person under the age of eighteen years shall be granted a learner’s licence to drive a motor cycle without gear except with the consent in writing of the person having the care of the person desiring the learner’s licence.
title: Restrictions on the granting of learner's licences for certain vehicles

chunk_text: (1) Any person who is not disqualified under section 4 for driving a motor vehicle and who is not for the time being disqualified for holding or obtaining a driving licence may, subject to the provisions of section 7, apply to 1[any of the licensing authority in the State]--
title: Grant of learner's licence

chunk_text: (i) in which he ordinarily resides or carries on business, or
title: Grant of learner's licence

chunk_text: (ii) in which the school or establishment referred to in section 12 from where he intends to receive instruction in driving a motor vehicle is situate, for the issue to him of a learner's licence.
title: Grant of learner's licence

chunk_text: (2) Every application under sub-section (1) shall be in such form and shall be accompanied by such documents 2[with such fee and submit in such manner, including electronic means] as may be prescribed by the Central Government.
title: Grant of learner's licence

chunk_text: (3) Every application 3[to drive a transport vehicle made] under sub-section (1) shall be accompanied by a medical certificate in such form as may be prescribed by the Central Government and signed by such registered medical practitioner, as the State Government or any person authorised in this behalf by the State Government may, by notification in the Official Gazette, appoint for this purpose:
title: Grant of learner's licence
Grant of learner's licence

chunk_text: (4) If, from the application or from the medical certificate referred to in sub-section (3), it appears that the applicant is suffering from any disease or disability which is likely to cause the driving by him of a motor vehicle of the class which he would be authorised by the learner's licence applied for to drive to be a source of danger to the public or to the passengers, the licensing authority shall refuse to issue the learner's licence:
title: Grant of learner's licence

chunk_text: Provided that a learners licence limited to driving an 5[adapted vehicle] may be issued to the applicant, if the licensing authority is satisfied that he is fit to drive such a carriage.
title: Grant of learner's licence

chunk_text: (5) No learner's licence shall be issued to any applicant unless he 6[ satisfies such conditions] as may be prescribed by the Central Government. .
title: Grant of learner's licence

chunk_text: (6) When an application has been duly made to the appropriate licensing authority and the applicant has satisfied such authority of his physical fitness under sub-section (3) and has passed to the satisfaction of the licensing authority the test referred to in sub-section (5), the licensing authority shall, subject to the provisions of section 7, issue the applicant a learner's licence unless the applicant is disqualified under section 4 for driving a motor vehicle or is for the time being disqualified for holding or obtaining a licence to drive a motor vehicle:
title: Grant of learner's licence

chunk_text: Provided that a licensing authority may issue a learner's licence to drive a motor cycle or a light motor vehicle notwithstanding that it is not the appropriate licensing authority, if such authority is satisfied that there is good reason for the applicant's inability to apply to the appropriate licensing authority.
title: Grant of learner's licence

chunk_text: 7[Provided further that a licencing authority may issue a learner's licence in electronic form and such manner as may be prescribed by the Central Government.:
title: Grant of learner's licence

chunk_text: Provided also that the licensing authority may, before issuing the license, verify the identity of the applicant in such manner as may be prescribed by the Central Government.]
title: Grant of learner's licence

chunk_text: (7) Where the Central Government is satisfied that it is necessary or expedient so to do, it may, by rules made in this behalf, exempt generally, either absolutely or subject to such conditions as may be specified in the rules, any class of persons from the provisions of sub-section (3), or sub-section (5), or both.
title: Grant of learner's licence

chunk_text: (8) Any learner's licence for driving a motor cycle in force immediately before the commencement of this Act shall, after such commencement, be deemed to be effective for driving a motor cycle with or without gear.
title: Grant of learner's licence

chunk_text: (1) Any person who is not for the time being disqualified for holding or obtaining a driving licence may apply to 1[any licensing authority in the State]--
title: Grant of driving licence

chunk_text: (i) in which he ordinarily resides or carries on business, or
title: Grant of driving licence

chunk_text: (ii) in which the school or establishment referred to in section 12 from where he is receiving or has received instruction in driving a motor vehicle is situated,
title: Grant of driving licence

chunk_text: for the issue to him of a driving licence.
title: Grant of driving licence

chunk_text: (2) Every application under sub-section (1) shall be in such form and shall be accompanied by such fee and such documents as may be prescribed by the Central Government.
title: Grant of driving licence

chunk_text: 2[(3) If the applicant passes such test as may be prescribed by the Central Government, he shall be issued the driving licence:
title: Grant of driving licence

chunk_text: Provided that no such test shall be necessary where the applicant produces proof to show that--
title: Grant of driving licence

chunk_text: (a) (i) the applicant has previously held a driving licence to drive such class of vehicle and that the period between thed ate of expiry of that licence and the date of the application does not exceed five years, or
title: Grant of driving licence

chunk_text: (ii) the applicant holds or has previously held a driving licence to drive such class of vehicle issued under section 18, or
title: Grant of driving licence

chunk_text: (iii) the applicant holds a driving licence to drive such class of vehicle issued by a competent authority of any country outside India, subject to the condition that the applicant complies with the provisions of sub-section (3) of section 8,
title: Grant of driving licence

chunk_text: (b) the applicant is not suffering from any disability which is likely to cause the driving by him to be a source of danger to the public; and the licensing authority may, for that purpose, require the applicant to produce a medical certificate in the same form and in the same manner as is referred to in sub-section (3) of section 8:
title: Grant of driving licence

chunk_text: 3[Provided further that a driving licence for driving an adapted vehicle may be issued to the applicant, if the licensing authority is satisfied that he is fit to drive such motor vehicle.]]
title: Grant of driving licence

chunk_text: (4) Where the application is for a licence to drive a transport vehicle, no such authorisation shall be granted to any applicant unless he possesses 4*** a driving certificate issued by a school or establishment referred to in section 12.
title: Grant of driving licence

chunk_text: 5[(5) Where the applicant does not pass the test; he may be permitted to re-appear for the test after a period of seven days:
title: Grant of driving licence

chunk_text: Provided that where the applicant does not pass the test even after three appearances, he shall not be qualified to re-appear for such test before the expiry of a period of sixty days from the date of last such test 6[and such applicant shall be required to complete a remedial driver training course from any school or establishment under section 12].]
title: Grant of driving licence

chunk_text: (6) The test of competence to drive shall be carried out in a vehicle of the type to which the application refers:
title: Grant of driving licence

chunk_text: Provided that a person who passed a test in driving a motor cycle with gear shall be deemed also to have passed a test in driving a motor cycle without gear.
title: Grant of driving licence

chunk_text: (7) When any application has been duly made to the appropriate licensing authority and the applicant has satisfied such authority of his competence to drive, the licensing authority shall issue the applicant a driving licence unless the applicant is for the time being disqualified for holding or obtaining a driving licence:
title: Grant of driving licence

chunk_text: Provided that a licensing authority may issue a driving licence to drive a motor cycle or a light motor vehicle notwithstanding that it is not the appropriate licensing authority, if the licensing authority is satisfied that there is good and sufficient reason for the applicant’s inability to apply to the appropriate licensing authority:
title: Grant of driving licence

chunk_text: Provided further that the licensing authority shall not issue a new driving licence to the applicant, if he had previously held a driving licence, unless it is satisfied that there is good and sufficient reason for his inability to obtain a duplicate copy of his former licence.
title: Grant of driving licence

chunk_text: (8) If the licensing authority is satisfied, after giving the applicant an opportunity of being heard, that he--
title: Grant of driving licence

chunk_text: (a) is a habitual criminal or a habitual drunkard; or
title: Grant of driving licence

chunk_text: (b) is a habitual addict to any narcotic drug or psychotropic substance within the meaning of the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act, 1985 (61 of 1985); or
title: Grant of driving licence

chunk_text: (c) is a person whose licence to drive any motor vehicle has, at any time earlier, been revoked, it may, for reasons to be recorded in writing, make an order refusing to issue a driving licence to such person and any person aggrieved by an order made by a licensing authority under this sub-section may, within thirty days of the receipt of the order, appeal to the prescribed authority.
title: Grant of driving licence

chunk_text: (9) Any driving licence for driving a motor cycle in force immediately before the commencement of this Act shall, after such commencement, bedeemed to be effective for driving a motor cycle with or without gear.
title: Grant of driving licence

chunk_text: 7[(10) Notwithstanding anything contained in this section, the driving licence to drive e-cart or e-rickshaw shall be issued in such manner and subject to such conditions, as may be prescribed.]
title: Grant of driving licence

chunk_text: (1) Every learner's licence and driving licence, except a driving licence issued under section 18, shall be in such form and shall contain such information as may be prescribed by the Central Government.
title: Form and contents of licences to drive

chunk_text: (2) A learner’s licence or, as the case may be, driving licence shall also be expressed as entitling the holder to drive a motor vehicle of one or more of the following classes, namely:
title: Form and contents of licences to drive

chunk_text: (a) motor cycle without gear;
title: Form and contents of licences to drive

chunk_text: (b) motor cycle with gear;
title: Form and contents of licences to drive

chunk_text: (c) 1[adapted vehicle];
title: Form and contents of licences to drive

chunk_text: (d) light motor vehicle;
title: Form and contents of licences to drive

chunk_text: 2[(e) transport vehicle;]
title: Form and contents of licences to drive

chunk_text: (i) road-roller;
title: Form and contents of licences to drive

chunk_text: (j) motor vehicle of a specified description.
title: Form and contents of licences to drive

chunk_text: (1) Any person holding a driving licence to drive any class or description of motor vehicles, who is not for the time being disqualified for holding or obtaining a driving licence to drive any other class or description of motor vehicles, may apply to 1[any licensing authority in the State] in which he resides or carries on his business in such form and accompanied by such documents and with such fees as may be prescribed by the Central Government for the addition of such other class or description of motor vehicles to the licence.
title: Additions to driving licence

chunk_text: (2) Subject to such rules as may be prescribed by the Central Government, the provisions of section 9 shall apply to an application under this section as if the said application were for the grant of a licence under that section to drive the class or description of motor vehicles which the applicant desires to be added to his licence.
title: Additions to driving licence

chunk_text: 2[Provided that the licensing authority may, before issuing the license verify the identity of the applicant in such manner as may be prescribed by the Central Government.]
title: Additions to driving licence

chunk_text: (1) The Central Government may make rules for the purpose of licensing and regulating, by the State Governments, schools or establishments (by whatever name called) for imparting instruction in driving of motor vehicles and matters connected therewith.
title: Licensing and regulation of schools or establishments for imparting instruction in driving of motor vehicles

chunk_text: (2) In particular, and without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing power, such rules may provide for all or any of the following matters, namely:--
title: Licensing and regulation of schools or establishments for imparting instruction in driving of motor vehicles

chunk_text: (a) licensing of such schools or establishments including grant, renewal and revocation of such licences;
title: Licensing and regulation of schools or establishments for imparting instruction in driving of motor vehicles

chunk_text: (b) supervision of such schools or establishments;
title: Licensing and regulation of schools or establishments for imparting instruction in driving of motor vehicles

chunk_text: (c) the form of application and the form of licence and the particulars to be contained therein;
title: Licensing and regulation of schools or establishments for imparting instruction in driving of motor vehicles

chunk_text: (d) fee to be paid with the application for such licences;
title: Licensing and regulation of schools or establishments for imparting instruction in driving of motor vehicles

chunk_text: (e) conditions subject to which such licences may be granted;
title: Licensing and regulation of schools or establishments for imparting instruction in driving of motor vehicles

chunk_text: (f) appeals against the orders of refusal to grant or renew such licences and appeals against the orders revoking such licences;
title: Licensing and regulation of schools or establishments for imparting instruction in driving of motor vehicles

chunk_text: (g) conditions subject to which a person may establish and maintain any such school or establishment for imparting instruction in driving of motor vehicles;
title: Licensing and regulation of schools or establishments for imparting instruction in driving of motor vehicles

chunk_text: (h) nature, syllabus and duration of course or courses for efficient instruction in driving any motor vehicle;
title: Licensing and regulation of schools or establishments for imparting instruction in driving of motor vehicles

chunk_text: (i) apparatus and equipments (including motor vehicles fitted with dual control) required for the purpose of imparting such instruction;
title: Licensing and regulation of schools or establishments for imparting instruction in driving of motor vehicles

chunk_text: (j) suitability of the premises at which such schools or establishments may be established or maintained and facilities to be provided therein;
title: Licensing and regulation of schools or establishments for imparting instruction in driving of motor vehicles

chunk_text: (k) qualifications, both educational and professional (including experience), which a person imparting instruction in driving a motor vehicle shall possess;
title: Licensing and regulation of schools or establishments for imparting instruction in driving of motor vehicles

chunk_text: (l) inspection of such schools and establishments (including the services rendered by them and the apparatus, equipments and motor vehicles maintained by them for imparting such instruction);
title: Licensing and regulation of schools or establishments for imparting instruction in driving of motor vehicles

chunk_text: (m) maintenance of records by such schools or establishments;
title: Licensing and regulation of schools or establishments for imparting instruction in driving of motor vehicles

chunk_text: (n) financial stability of such schools or establishments;
title: Licensing and regulation of schools or establishments for imparting instruction in driving of motor vehicles

chunk_text: (o) the driving certificates, if any, to be issued by such schools or establishments and the form in which such driving certificates shall be issued and the requirements to be complied with for the purposes of issuing such certificates;
title: Licensing and regulation of schools or establishments for imparting instruction in driving of motor vehicles

chunk_text: (p) such other matters as may be necessary to carry out the purposes of this section.
title: Licensing and regulation of schools or establishments for imparting instruction in driving of motor vehicles

chunk_text: (3) Where the Central Government is satisfied that it is necessary or expedient so to do, it may, by rules made in this behalf, exempt generally, either absolutely or subject to such conditions as may be specified in the rules, any class of schools or establishments imparting instruction in driving of motor vehicles or matters connected therewith from the provisions of this section.
title: Licensing and regulation of schools or establishments for imparting instruction in driving of motor vehicles

chunk_text: (4) A school or establishment imparting instruction in driving of motor vehicles or matters connected therewith immediately before the commencement of this Act whether under a licence or not, may continue to impart such instruction without a licence issued under this Act for a period of one month from such commencement, and if it has made an application for such licence under this Act within the said period of one month and such application is in the prescribed form, contains the prescribed particulars and is accompanied by the prescribed fee, till the disposal of such application by the licensing authority.
title: Licensing and regulation of schools or establishments for imparting instruction in driving of motor vehicles

chunk_text: 1[(5) Notwithstanding anything contained in any other provision, where any school or establishment has been accredited by a body notified by the Central Government under any other law for the time being in force, any person who has successfully completed a training module at such school or establishment covering a particular type of motor vehicle shall be eligible to obtain a driving licence for such type of motor vehicle.
title: Licensing and regulation of schools or establishments for imparting instruction in driving of motor vehicles

chunk_text: (6) The curriculum of the training module referred to in sub-section (5) and the remedial driver training course referred to in sub-section (5) of section 9 shall be such as may be prescribed by the Central Government and that Government may make rules for the regulation of such schools or establishments.]
title: Licensing and regulation of schools or establishments for imparting instruction in driving of motor vehicles

chunk_text: A learner’s licence or a driving licence issued under this Act shall be effective throughout India.
title: Extent of effectiveness of licences, to drive motor vehicles

chunk_text: (1) A learner's licence issued under this Act shall, subject to the other provisions of this Act, be effective for a period of six months from the date of issue of the licence.
title: Currency of licences to drive motor vehicles

chunk_text: (2) A driving licence issued or renewed under this Act shall,--
title: Currency of licences to drive motor vehicles

chunk_text: (a) in the case of a licence to drive a transport vehicle, be effective for a period of 1[five years]:
title: Currency of licences to drive motor vehicles
Currency of licences to drive motor vehicles

chunk_text: 3[Provided that in the case of licence to drive a transport vehicle carrying goods of dangerous or hazardous nature be effective for a period of 4[three years and renewal thereof shall be subject to such conditions as the Central Government may prescribe; and];]
title: Currency of licences to drive motor vehicles

chunk_text: 5[(b) in the case of any other licence, subject to such conditions as the Central Government may prescribe, if the person obtaining the licence, either originally or on renewal thereof,--
title: Currency of licences to drive motor vehicles

chunk_text: (i) has not attained the age of thirty years on the date of issue or, renewal thereof, be effective until the date on which such person attains the age of forty years; or
title: Currency of licences to drive motor vehicles

chunk_text: (ii) has attained the age of thirty years but has not attained the age of fifty years on the date of issue or, renewal thereof, be effective for a period of ten years from the date of such issue or renewal; or
title: Currency of licences to drive motor vehicles

chunk_text: (iii) has attained the age of fifty years but has not attained the age of fifty-five years on the date of issue or, renewal thereof, be effective until the date on which such person attains the age of sixty years; or
title: Currency of licences to drive motor vehicles

chunk_text: (iv) has attained the age of fifty-five years on the date of issue or as the case may be, renewal thereof, be effective for a period of five years from the date of such issue or renewal.]
title: Currency of licences to drive motor vehicles
Currency of licences to drive motor vehicles

chunk_text: (1) Any licensing authority may, on application made to it, renew a driving licence issued under the provisions of this Act with effect from the date of its expiry:
title: Renewal of driving licences

chunk_text: Provided that in any case where the application for the renewal of a licence is made 1[either one year prior to date of its expiry or within one year] after the date of its expiry, the driving licence shall be renewed with effect from the date of its renewal:
title: Renewal of driving licences

chunk_text: Provided further that where the application is for the renewal of a licence to drive a transport vehicle or where in any other case the applicant has attained the age of forty years, the same shall be accompanied by a medical certificate in the same form and in the same manner as is referred to in sub-section (3) of section 8, and the provisions of sub-section (4) of section 8 shall, so far as may be, apply in relation to every such case as they apply in relation to a learners licence.
title: Renewal of driving licences

chunk_text: (2) An application for the renewal of a driving licence shall be made in such form and accompanied by such documents as may be prescribed by the Central Government.
title: Renewal of driving licences

chunk_text: (3) Where an application for the renewal of a driving licence is made previous to, or not more than 2[one year] after the date of its expiry, the fee payable for such renewal shall be such as may be prescribed by the Central Government in this behalf.
title: Renewal of driving licences

chunk_text: (4) Where an application for the renewal of a driving licence is made more than 1 [one year] after the date of its expiry, the fee payable for such renewal shall be such amount as may be prescribed by the Central Government:
title: Renewal of driving licences

chunk_text: Provided that the fee referred to in sub-section (3) may be accepted by the licensing authority in respect of an application for the renewal of a driving licence made under this sub-section if it is satisfied that the applicant was prevented by good and sufficient cause from applying within the time specified in sub-section (3):
title: Renewal of driving licences

chunk_text: Provided further that if the application is made more than 3[one year after the driving licence has ceased to be effective, the licensing authority shall] refuse to renew the driving licence, unless the applicant undergoes and passes to its satisfaction the test of competence to drive referred to in sub-section (3) of section 9.
title: Renewal of driving licences

chunk_text: (5) Where the application for renewal has been rejected, the fee paid shall be refunded to such extent and in such manner as may be prescribed by the Central Government.
title: Renewal of driving licences

chunk_text: (6) Where the authority renewing the driving licence is not the authority which issued the driving licence it shall intimate the fact of renewal to the authority which issued the driving licence.
title: Renewal of driving licences

chunk_text: Notwithstanding anything contained in the foregoing sections, any licensing authority may at any time revoke a driving licence or may require, as a condition of continuing to hold such driving licence, the holder thereof to produce a medical certificate in the same form and in the same manner as is referred to in sub-section (3) of section 8, if the licensing authority has reasonable grounds to belive that the holder of the driving licence is, by virtue of any disease or disability, unfit to drive a motor vehicle and where the authority revoking a driving licence is not the authority which issued the same, it shall intimate the fact of revocation to the authority which issued that licence.
title: Revocation of driving licence on grounds of disease or disability

chunk_text: (1) Where a licensing authority refuses to issue any learner’s licence or to issue or renew, or revokes, any driving licence, or refuses to add a class or description of motor vehicle to any driving licence, it shall do so by an order communicated to the applicant or the holder, as the case may be, giving the reasons in writing for such refusal or revocation.
title: Orders refusing or revoking driving licences and appeals therefrom

chunk_text: (2) Any person aggrieved by an order made under sub-section (1) may, within thirty days of the service on him of the order, appeal to the prescribed authority which shall decide the appeal after giving such person and the authority which made the order an opportunity of being heard and the decision of the appellate authority shall be binding on the authority which made the order.
title: Orders refusing or revoking driving licences and appeals therefrom

chunk_text: (1) Such authority as may be prescribed by the Central Government may issue driving licence valid throughout India to persons who have completed their eighteenth year to drive motor vehicles which are the property or for the time being under the exclusive control of the Central Government and are used for Government purposes relating to the defence of the country and unconnected with any commercial enterprise.
title: Driving Licences to drive motor vehicles, belonging to the Central Government

chunk_text: (2) A driving licence issued under this section shall specify the class or description of vehicle which the holder is entitled to drive and the period for which he is so entitled.
title: Driving Licences to drive motor vehicles, belonging to the Central Government

chunk_text: (3) A driving licence issued under this section shall not entitle the holder to drive any motor vehicle except a motor vehicle referred to in sub-section (1).
title: Driving Licences to drive motor vehicles, belonging to the Central Government

chunk_text: (4) The authority issuing any driving licence under this section shall, at the request of any State Government, furnish such information respecting any person to whom a driving licence is issued as that Government may at any time require.
title: Driving Licences to drive motor vehicles, belonging to the Central Government

chunk_text:
(1) If a licensing authority is satisfied, after giving the holder of a driving licence an
opportunity of being heard, that he--
title: Power of licensing authority to disqualify from holding a driving licence or revoke such licence

chunk_text: (a) is a habitual criminal or a habitual drunkard; or
title: Power of licensing authority to disqualify from holding a driving licence or revoke such licence

chunk_text:
(b) is a habitual addict to any narcotic drug or psychotropic substance within the meaning of the
Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act, 1985 (61 of 1985); or
title: Power of licensing authority to disqualify from holding a driving licence or revoke such licence

chunk_text: (c) is using or has used a motor vehicle in the commission of a cognizable offence; or
title: Power of licensing authority to disqualify from holding a driving licence or revoke such licence

chunk_text:
(d) has by his previous conduct as driver of a motor vehicle shown that his driving is likely to be
attended with danger to the public; or
title: Power of licensing authority to disqualify from holding a driving licence or revoke such licence

chunk_text:
(e) has obtained any driving licence or a licence to drive a particular class or description of motor
vehicle by fraud or misrepresentation; or
title: Power of licensing authority to disqualify from holding a driving licence or revoke such licence

chunk_text:
(f) has committed any such act which is likely to cause nuisance or danger to the public, as may
be prescribed by the Central Government, having regard to the objects of this Act; or
title: Power of licensing authority to disqualify from holding a driving licence or revoke such licence

chunk_text:
(g) has failed to submit to, or has not passed, the tests referred to in the proviso to sub-section (3)
of section 22; or
title: Power of licensing authority to disqualify from holding a driving licence or revoke such licence

chunk_text:
(h) being a person under the age of eighteen years who has been granted a learner's licence or a
driving licence with the consent in writing of the person having the care of the holder of the licence
and has ceased to be in such care,
title: Power of licensing authority to disqualify from holding a driving licence or revoke such licence

chunk_text: it may, for reasons to be recorded in writing, make an order--
title: Power of licensing authority to disqualify from holding a driving licence or revoke such licence

chunk_text:
(i) disqualifying that person for a specified period for holding or obtaining any driving licence to
drive all or any classes or descriptions of vehicles specified in the licence; or
title: Power of licensing authority to disqualify from holding a driving licence or revoke such licence

chunk_text: (ii) revoke any such licence.
title: Power of licensing authority to disqualify from holding a driving licence or revoke such licence

chunk_text:
1[(1A) Where a licence has been forwarded to the licensing authority under sub-section (4) of
section 206, the licensing authority, if satisfied after giving the holder of the driving licence an
opportunity of being heard, may either discharge the holder of a driving licence or, it may for detailed
reasons recorded in writing, make an order disqualifying such person from holding or obtaining any
licence to drive all or any class or description of vehicles specified in the licence--
title: Power of licensing authority to disqualify from holding a driving licence or revoke such licence

chunk_text: (a) for a first offence, for a period of three months;
title: Power of licensing authority to disqualify from holding a driving licence or revoke such licence

chunk_text: (b) for a second or subsequent offence, with revocation of the driving licence of such person:
title: Power of licensing authority to disqualify from holding a driving licence or revoke such licence

chunk_text:
Provided that where a driving licence is revoked under this section, the name of the holder of such
driving licence may be placed in the public domain in such manner as may be prescribed by the Central
Government.]
title: Power of licensing authority to disqualify from holding a driving licence or revoke such licence

chunk_text:
(2) Where an order under sub-section (1) 2[or sub-section (1A)] is made, the holder of a driving
licence shall forthwith surrender his driving licence to the licensing authority making the order, if the
driving licence has not already been surrendered, and the licensing authority shall,--
title: Power of licensing authority to disqualify from holding a driving licence or revoke such licence

chunk_text:
(a) if the driving licence is a driving licence issued under this Act, keep it until the
disqualification has expired or has been removed; or
title: Power of licensing authority to disqualify from holding a driving licence or revoke such licence

chunk_text:
(b) if it is not a driving licence issued under this Act, endorse the disqualification upon it and send
it to the licensing authority by which it was issued; or
title: Power of licensing authority to disqualify from holding a driving licence or revoke such licence

chunk_text:
(c) in the case of revocation of any licence, endorse the revocation upon it and if it is not the
authority which issued the same, intimate the fact of revocation to the authority which issued that
licence:
title: Power of licensing authority to disqualify from holding a driving licence or revoke such licence

chunk_text:
3[Provided that the driving licence shall be returned to the holder at the end of the period of
disqualification only if he successfully completes the driver refresher training course.]
title: Power of licensing authority to disqualify from holding a driving licence or revoke such licence

chunk_text:
4
[(2A) The licence holder whose licence has been suspended shall undergo the driver refresher training
course from a school or establishment licenced and regulated under section 12 or such other agency, as
may be notified by the Central Government.
title: Power of licensing authority to disqualify from holding a driving licence or revoke such licence

chunk_text:
(2B) The nature, syllabus and duration of the driver refresher training course shall be such as may be
prescribed by the Central Government.]
title: Power of licensing authority to disqualify from holding a driving licence or revoke such licence

chunk_text:
(3) Any person aggrieved by an order made by a licensing authority under sub-section (1) 2[or subsection (1A)] may, within thirty days of the receipt of the order, appeal to the prescribed authority, and
such appellate authority shall give notice to the licensing authority and hear either party if so required by
that party and may pass such order as it thinks fit and an order passed by any such appellate authority
shall be final.
title: Power of licensing authority to disqualify from holding a driving licence or revoke such licence

chunk_text: (1) Where a person is convicted of an offence under this Act or of an offence in the commission of which a motor vehicle was used, the Court by which such person is convicted may, subject to the provisions of this Act, in addition to imposing any other punishment authorised by law, declare the persons so convicted to be disqualified, for such period as the Court may specify, from holding any driving licence to drive all classes or description of vehicles, or any particular class or description of such vehicles, as are specified in such licence:
title: Power of Court to disqualify

chunk_text: Provided that in respect of an offence punishable under section 183 no such order shall be made for the first or second offence.
title: Power of Court to disqualify

chunk_text: (2) Where a person is convicted of an offence under clause (c) of sub-section (1) of section 132, section 134 or section 185, the Court convicting any person of any such offence shall order the disqualification under sub-section (1), and if the offence is relatable to clause (c) of sub-section (1) of section 132 or section 134, such disqualification shall be for a period of not less than one month, and if the offence is relatable to section 185, such disqualification shall be for a period of not less than six months.
title: Power of Court to disqualify

chunk_text: (3) A Court shall, unless for special reasons to be recorded in writing it thinks fit to order otherwise, order the disqualification of a person-
title: Power of Court to disqualify

chunk_text: (a) who having been convicted of an offence punishable under section 184 is again convicted of an offence punishable under that section,
title: Power of Court to disqualify

chunk_text: (b) who is convicted of an offence punishable under section 189, or
title: Power of Court to disqualify

chunk_text: (c) who is convicted of an offence punishable under section 192:
title: Power of Court to disqualify

chunk_text: Provided that the period of disqualification shall not exceed, in the case referred to in clause (a), five years, or, in the case referred to in clause (b), two years or, in the case referred to in clause (c), one year.
title: Power of Court to disqualify

chunk_text: (4) A Court ordering the disqualification of a person convicted of an offence punishable under section 184 may direct that such person shall, whether he has previously passed the test of competence to drive as referred to in sub-section (3) of section 9 or not, remain disqualified until he has subsequent to the making of the order of disqualification passed that test to the satisfaction of the licensing authority.
title: Power of Court to disqualify

chunk_text: (5) The Court to which an appeal would ordinarily lie from any conviction of an offence of the nature specified in sub-section (1) may set aside or vary any order of disqualification made under that sub-section notwithstanding that no appeal would lie against the conviction as a result of which such order of disqualification was made.
title: Power of Court to disqualify

chunk_text: (1) Where, in relation to a person who had been previously convicted of an offence punishable under section 184, a case is registered by a police officer on the allegation that such person has, by such dangerous driving as is referred to in the said section 184, of any class or description of motor vehicle caused the death of, or grievous hurt to, one or more persons, the driving licence held by such person shall in relation to such class or description of motor vehicle become suspended--
title: Suspension of driving licence in certain cases

chunk_text: (a) for a period of six months from the date on which the case is registered, or
title: Suspension of driving licence in certain cases

chunk_text: (b) if such person is discharged or acquitted before the expiry of the period aforesaid, until such discharge or acquittal, as the case may be.
title: Suspension of driving licence in certain cases

chunk_text: (2) Where by virtue of the provisions of sub-section (1), the driving licence held by a person becomes suspended, the police officer, by whom the case referred to in sub-section (1) is registered, shall bring such suspension to the notice of the Court competent to take cognizance of such offence, and thereupon, such Court shall take possession of the driving licence, endorse the suspension thereon and intimate the fact of such endorsement to the licensing authority by which the licence was granted or last renewed.
title: Suspension of driving licence in certain cases

chunk_text: (3) Where the person referred to in sub-section (1) is acquitted or discharged, the Court shall cancel the endorsement on such driving licence with regard to the suspension thereof.
title: Suspension of driving licence in certain cases

chunk_text: (4) If a driving licence in relation to a particular class or description of motor vehicles is suspended under sub-section (1), the person holding such licence shall be debarred from holding or obtaining any licence to drive such particular class or description of motor vehicles so long as the suspension of the driving licence remains in force.
title: Suspension of driving licence in certain cases

chunk_text: (1) Without prejudice to the provisions of sub-section (3) of section 20 where a person, referred to in sub-section (1) of section 21 is convicted of an offence of causing, by such dangerous driving as is referred to in section 184 of any class or description of motor vehicle the death of, or grievous hurt to, one or more persons, the Court by which such person is convicted may cancel, or suspend for such period as it may think fit, the driving licence held by such person in so far as it relates to that class or description of motor vehicle.
title: Suspension or cancellation of driving licence on conviction

chunk_text: (2) Without prejudice to the provisions of sub-section (2) of section 20, if a person, having been previously convicted of an offence punishable under section 185 is again convicted of an offence punishable under that section, the Court, making such subsequent conviction, shall, by order, cancel the driving licence held by such person.
title: Suspension or cancellation of driving licence on conviction

chunk_text: (3) If a driving licence is cancelled or suspended under this section, the Court shall take the driving licence in its custody, endorse the cancellation or, as the case may be, suspension, thereon and send the driving licence so endorsed to the authority by which the licence was issued or last renewed and such authority shall, on receipt of the licence, keep the licence in its safe custody, and in the case of a suspended licence, return the licence to the holder thereof after the expiry of the period of suspension on an application made by him for such return:
title: Suspension or cancellation of driving licence on conviction

chunk_text: Provided that no such licence shall be returned unless the holder thereof has, after the expiry of the period of suspension, undergone and passed, to the satisfaction of the licensing authority by which the licence was issued or last renewed, a fresh test of competence to drive referred to in sub-section (3) of section 9 and produced a medical certificate in the same form and in the same manner as is referred to in sub-section (3) of section 8.
title: Suspension or cancellation of driving licence on conviction

chunk_text: (4) If a licence to drive a particular class or description of motor vehicles is cancelled or suspended under this section, the person holding such a licence shall be debarred from holding, or obtaining, any licence to drive such particular class or description of motor vehicles so long as the cancellation or suspension of the driving licence remains in force.
title: Suspension or cancellation of driving licence on conviction

chunk_text: (1) A person in respect of whom any disqualification order is made under section 19 or section 20 shall be debarred to the extent and for the period specified in such order from holding or obtaining a driving licence and the driving licence, if any, held by such person at the date of the order shall cease to be effective to such extent and during such period.
title: Effect of disqualification order

chunk_text: (2) The operation of a disqualification order made under section 20 shall not be suspended or postponed while an appeal is pending against such order or against the conviction as a result of which such order is made, unless the appellate court so directs.
title: Effect of disqualification order

chunk_text: (3) Any person in respect of whom any disqualification order has been made may at any time after the expiry of six months from the date of the order apply to the Court or other authority by which the order was made, to remove the disqualification; and the Court or authority, as the case may be, may, having regard to all the circumstances, either cancel or vary the disqualification order:
title: Effect of disqualification order

chunk_text: Provided that where the Court or other authority refuses to cancel or vary any disqualification order under this section, a second application thereunder shall not be entertained before the expiry of a period of three months from the date of such refusal.
title: Effect of disqualification order

chunk_text: (1) The Court or authority making an order of disqualification shall endorse or cause to be endorsed upon the driving licence if any, held by the person disqualified, particulars of the order of disqualification and of any conviction of an offence in respect of which an order of disqualification is made; and particulars of any cancellation or variation of an order of disqualification made under sub-section (3) of section 23 shall be similarly so endorsed.
title: Endorsement

chunk_text: (2) A Court by which any person is convicted of an offence under this Act as may be prescribed by the Central Government, having regard to the objects of this Act, shall, whether or not a disqualification order is made in respect of such conviction, endorse or cause to be endorsed particulars of such conviction on any driving licence held by the person convicted.
title: Endorsement

chunk_text: (3) Any person accused of an offence prescribed under sub-section (2) shall when attending the Court bring with him his driving licence if it is in his possession.
title: Endorsement

chunk_text: (4) Where any person is convicted of any offence under this Act and sentenced to imprisonment for a period exceeding three months the Court awarding the sentence shall endorse the fact of such sentence upon the driving licence of the person concerned and the prosecuting authority shall intimate the fact of such endorsement to the authority by which the driving licence was granted or last renewed.
title: Endorsement

chunk_text: (5) When the driving licence is endorsed or caused to be endorsed by any Court, such Court shall send the particulars of the endorsement to the licensing authority by which the driving licence was granted or last renewed.
title: Endorsement

chunk_text: (6) Where on an appeal against any conviction or order of a Court, which has been endorsed on a driving licence, the appellate court varies or sets aside the conviction or order, the appellate court shall inform the licensing authority by which the driving licence was granted or last renewed and such authority shall amend or cause to be amended the endorsement.
title: Endorsement

chunk_text: (1) An endorsement on any driving licence shall be transferred to any new or duplicate driving licence obtained by the holder thereof until the holder becomes entitled under the provisions of this section to have a driving licence issued to him free from endorsement.
title: Transfer of endorsement and issue of driving licence free from endorsement

chunk_text: (2) Where a driving licence is required to be endorsed and the driving licence is not in the possession of the Court or authority by which the endorsement is to be made, then--
title: Transfer of endorsement and issue of driving licence free from endorsement

chunk_text: (a) if the person in respect of whom the endorsement is to be made is at the time the holder of a driving licence, he shall produce the driving licence to the Court or authority within five days, or such longer time as the Court or authority may fix; or
title: Transfer of endorsement and issue of driving licence free from endorsement

chunk_text: (b) if, not being then the holder of a driving licence, he subsequently obtains a driving licence, he shall within five days after obtaining the driving licence produce it to the Court or authority,
title: Transfer of endorsement and issue of driving licence free from endorsement

chunk_text: and if the driving licence is not produced within the time specified, it shall, on the expiration of such time, be of no effect until it is produced for the purpose of endorsement.
title: Transfer of endorsement and issue of driving licence free from endorsement

chunk_text: (3) A person whose driving licence has been endorsed shall, if during a continuous period of three years after such endorsement no further endorsement has been made against him, be entitled on surrendering his driving licence and on payment of a fee of five rupees, to receive a new driving licence free from all endorsements:
title: Transfer of endorsement and issue of driving licence free from endorsement

chunk_text: Provided that if the endorsement is only in respect of an offence contravening the speed limits referred to in section 112, such person shall be entitled to receive a new driving licence free from such endorsements on the expiration of one year of the date of the endorsement:
title: Transfer of endorsement and issue of driving licence free from endorsement

chunk_text: Provided further that in reckoning the said period of three years and one year, respectively, any period during which the said person was disqualified for holding or obtaining a driving licence shall be excluded.
title: Transfer of endorsement and issue of driving licence free from endorsement

chunk_text: 1[25A. National Register of Driving Licences.---(1) The Central Government shall maintain a National Register of Driving Licences in such form and manner as may be prescribed.
title: National Register of Driving Licences

chunk_text: (2) All State Registers of Driving Licences shall be subsumed under the National Register of Driving Licences by a date to be notified by the Central Government.
title: National Register of Driving Licences

chunk_text: (3) No driving licence issued, or renewed, under this Act shall be valid unless it has been issued a unique driving licence number under the National Register of Driving Licences.
title: National Register of Driving Licences

chunk_text: (4) All State Governments and licensing authorities under this Act shall transmit all information including contained data in the State Register of Driving Licences in such form and manner as may be prescribed by the Central Government.
title: National Register of Driving Licences

chunk_text: (5) The State Governments shall be entitled to access the National Register and update their records in such manner as may be prescribed by the Central Government.]
title: National Register of Driving Licences

chunk_text: 1[26. Maintenance of State Registers of Driving Licences.-- Each State Government shall maintain, in such form as may be prescribed by the Central Government, a register to be known as the State Register of Driving Licences, in respect of driving licences issued and renewed by the licensing authorities of the State Government, containing particulars, including--
title: Maintenance of State Registers of Driving Licences

chunk_text: (a) names and addresses of holders of driving licences;
title: Maintenance of State Registers of Driving Licences

chunk_text: (b) licence numbers;
title: Maintenance of State Registers of Driving Licences

chunk_text: (c) dates of issue or renewal of licences;
title: Maintenance of State Registers of Driving Licences

chunk_text: (d) dates of expiry of licences;
title: Maintenance of State Registers of Driving Licences

chunk_text: (e) classes and types of vehicles authorised to be driven; and
title: Maintenance of State Registers of Driving Licences

chunk_text: (f) such other particulars as the Central Government may prescribe.]
title: Maintenance of State Registers of Driving Licences

chunk_text: (2) Each State Government shall supply to the Central Government a 2[printed copy or copy in such other form as the Central Government may require] of the State Register of Driving Licences and shall inform the Central Government without delay of all additions to and other amendments in such register made from time to time.
title: Maintenance of State Registers of Driving Licences

chunk_text: (3) The State Register of Driving Licences shall be maintained in such manner as may be prescribed by the State Government.
title: Maintenance of State Registers of Driving Licences

chunk_text: The Central Government may make rules--
title: Power of Central Government to make rules

chunk_text: 1[(a) specifications relating to e-cart and e-rickshaw under sub-section (2) of section 2A;]
title: Power of Central Government to make rules

chunk_text: 2[(aa)] regarding conditions referred to in sub-section (2) of section 3;
title: Power of Central Government to make rules
