chunk_text: (g) the manner in which the particulars referred to in sub-section (2) of section 58 and other prescribed particulars shall be exhibited;
title: Power of State Government to make rules

chunk_text: (h) the exemption of prescribed persons or prescribed classes of persons from payment of all or any portion of the fees payable under this Chapter;
title: Power of State Government to make rules

chunk_text: (i) the forms, other than those prescribed by the Central Government, to be used for the purpose of this Chapter;
title: Power of State Government to make rules

chunk_text: (j) the communication between registering authorities of particulars of certificates of registration and by owners of vehicles registered outside the State of particulars of such vehicles and of their registration;
title: Power of State Government to make rules

chunk_text: (k) the amount or amounts under sub-section (13) of section 41 or sub-section (7) of section 47 or sub-section (4) of section 49 or sub-section (5) of section 50;
title: Power of State Government to make rules

chunk_text: (l) the extension of the validity of certificates of fitness pending consideration of applications for their renewal;
title: Power of State Government to make rules

chunk_text: (m) the exemption from the provisions of this Chapter, and the conditions and fees for exemption, of motor vehicles in the possession of dealers;
title: Power of State Government to make rules

chunk_text: (n) the form in which and the period within which the return under section 62 shall be sent;
title: Power of State Government to make rules
Power of State Government to make rules

chunk_text: (p) any other matter which is to be or may be prescribed.
title: Power of State Government to make rules

chunk_text: (1) No owner of a motor vehicle shall use or permit the use of the vehicle as a transport vehicle in any public place whether or not such vehicle is actually carrying any passengers or goods save in accordance with the conditions of a permit granted or countersigned by a Regional or State Transport Authority or any prescribed authority authorising him the use of the vehicle in that place in the manner in which the vehicle is being used:
title: Necessity for permits

chunk_text: Provided that a stage carriage permit shall, subject to any conditions that may be specified in the permit, authorise the use of the vehicle as a contract carriage:
title: Necessity for permits

chunk_text: Provided further that a stage carriage permit may, subject to any conditions that may be specified in the permit, authorise the use of the vehicle as a goods carriage either when carrying passengers or not:
title: Necessity for permits

chunk_text: Provided also that a goods carriage permit shall, subject to any conditions that may be specified in the permit, authorise the use of the vehicle for the carriage of goods for or in connection with a trade or business carried on by him.
title: Necessity for permits

chunk_text: 1[Provided also that where a transport vehicle has been issued any permit or permits, as well as a licence under this Act, such vehicle may be used either under the permit, or permits, so issued to it, or under such licence, at the discretion of the vehicle owner.]
title: Necessity for permits

chunk_text: (2) The holder of a goods carriage permit may use the vehicle, for the drawing of any public or semitrailer not owned by him, subject to such conditions as may be prescribed.
title: Necessity for permits

chunk_text: 2[Provided that the holder of a permit of any articulated vehicle may use the prime-mover of that articulated vehicle for any other semi-trailor.]
title: Necessity for permits

chunk_text: (3) The provisions of sub-section (1) shall not apply--
title: Necessity for permits

chunk_text: (a) to any transport vehicle owned by the Central Government or a State Government and used for Government purposes unconnected with any commercial enterprise;
title: Necessity for permits

chunk_text: (b) to any transport vehicle owned by a local authority or by a person acting under contract with a local authority and used solely for road cleansing, road watering or conservancy purposes;
title: Necessity for permits

chunk_text: (c) to any transport vehicle used solely for police, fire brigade or ambulance purposes;
title: Necessity for permits

chunk_text: (d) to any transport vehicle used solely for the conveyance of corpses and the mourners accompanying the corpses;
title: Necessity for permits

chunk_text: (e) to any transport vehicle used for towing a disabled vehicle or for removing goods from a disabled vehicle to a place of safety;
title: Necessity for permits

chunk_text: (f) to any transport vehicle used for any other public purpose as may be prescribed by the State Government in this behalf;
title: Necessity for permits

chunk_text: (g) to any transport vehicle used by a person who manufactures or deals in motor vehicles or builds bodies for attachment to chassis, solely for such purposes and in accordance with such conditions as the Central Government may, by notification in the Official Gazette, specify in this behalf;
title: Necessity for permits
Necessity for permits

chunk_text: (i) to any goods vehicle, the gross vehicle weight of which does not exceed 3,000 kilograms;
title: Necessity for permits

chunk_text: (j) subject to such conditions as the Central Government may, by notification in the Official Gazette, specify, to any transport vehicle purchased in one State and proceeding to a place, situated in that State or in any other State, without carrying any passenger or goods;
title: Necessity for permits

chunk_text: (k) to any transport vehicle which has been temporarily registered under section 43 while proceeding empty to any place for the purpose of registration of the vehicle;
title: Necessity for permits
Necessity for permits

chunk_text: (m) to any transport vehicle which, owing to flood, earthquake or any other natural calamity, obstruction on road, or unforeseen circumstances is required to be diverted through any other route, whether within or outside the State, with a view to enabling it to reach its destination;
title: Necessity for permits

chunk_text: (n) to any transport vehicle used for such purposes as the Central or State Government may, by order, specify;
title: Necessity for permits

chunk_text: (o) to any transport vehicle which is subject to a hire-purchase, lease or hypothecation agreement and which owing to the default of the owner has been taken possession of by or on behalf of, the person with whom the owner has entered into such agreement, to enable such motor vehicle to reach its destination; or
title: Necessity for permits

chunk_text: (p) to any transport vehicle while proceeding empty to any place for purpose of repair.
title: Necessity for permits

chunk_text: 5[(q) to any transport vehicle having been issued a licence under a scheme, under sub-section (3) of section 67 or sub-section (1) of section 88A, or plying under such orders as may be issued by the Central Government or by the State Government.](4) Subject to the provisions of sub-section (3), sub-section (1) shall if the State Government by rule made under section 96 so prescribes, apply to any motor vehicle adapted to carry more than nine persons excluding the driver.
title: Necessity for permits

chunk_text: 1[66A. National Transportation Policy.-- The Central Government may develop a National Transportation Policy consistent with the objects of this Act in concurrence with the State Governments and other agencies with a view to--
title: National Transportation Policy

chunk_text: (i) establish a planning framework for passengers and goods transportation within which transport bodies are to operate;
title: National Transportation Policy

chunk_text: (ii) establish a medium and long term planning framework for all forms of road transport, identify areas for the development of transport improvement infrastructure across India in consultation with the authorities and agencies related to ports, railways and aviation as well as with local and State level planning, land holding and regulatory authorities for the delivery of an integrated multimodal transport system;
title: National Transportation Policy

chunk_text: (iii) establish the framework of grant of permits and schemes;
title: National Transportation Policy

chunk_text: (iv) establish strategic policy for transport by road and its role as a link to other means of transport;
title: National Transportation Policy

chunk_text: (v) identify strategic policies and specify priorities for the transport system that address current and future challenges;
title: National Transportation Policy

chunk_text: (vi) provide medium to long term strategic directions, priorities and actions;
title: National Transportation Policy

chunk_text: (vii) promote competition, innovation, increase in capacity, seamless mobility and greater efficiency in transport of goods or livestock or passengers, and economical use of resources;
title: National Transportation Policy

chunk_text: (viii) safeguard the interest of the public and promote equity, while seeking to enhance private participation and public-private partnership in the transport sector;
title: National Transportation Policy

chunk_text: (ix) demonstrate an integrated approach to transport and land use planning;
title: National Transportation Policy

chunk_text: (x) identify the challenges that the National Transportation Policy seeks to address; and
title: National Transportation Policy

chunk_text: (xi) address any other matter deemed relevant by the Central Government.]
title: National Transportation Policy

chunk_text: 1[66B. No bar against permit holders to apply and hold licences under schemes.-- No person who holds the permit issued under this Act shall--
title: No bar against permit holders to apply and hold licences under schemes

chunk_text: (a) be disqualified from applying for a licence under the scheme made under sub-section (3) of section 67 or sub-section (1) of section 88A by reason of holding such permit; and
title: No bar against permit holders to apply and hold licences under schemes

chunk_text: (b) be required to get such permit cancelled on being issued a licence under any scheme made under this Act.]
title: No bar against permit holders to apply and hold licences under schemes

chunk_text: 1[(1) A State Government, having regard to--
title: Power to State Government to control road transport

chunk_text: (a) the advantages offered to the public, trade and industry by the development of motor transport;
title: Power to State Government to control road transport

chunk_text: (b) the desirability of co-ordinating road and rail transport;
title: Power to State Government to control road transport

chunk_text: (c) the desirability of preventing the deterioration of the road system, and
title: Power to State Government to control road transport

chunk_text: (d) promoting effective competition among the transport service providers,
title: Power to State Government to control road transport

chunk_text: may, from time to time, by notification in the Official Gazette issue directions both to the State Transport Authority and Regional Transport Authority regarding the passengers convenience, economically competitive fares, prevention of overcrowding and road safety.]
title: Power to State Government to control road transport

chunk_text: (2) Any direction under sub-section (1) regarding the fixing of fares and freights for stage carriages, contract carriages and goods carriages may provide that such fares or freights shall be inclusive of the tax payable by the passengers or the consignors of the goods, as the case may be, to the operators of the stage carriages, contract carriages or goods carriages under any law for the time being in force relating to tax on passengers and goods:
title: Power to State Government to control road transport

chunk_text: 2[Provided that the State Government may subject to such conditions as it may deem fit, and with a view to achieving the objectives specified in clause (d) of sub-section (1), relax all or any of the provisions made under this Chapter.]
title: Power to State Government to control road transport

chunk_text: 2[(3) Notwithstanding anything contained in this Act, the State Government may, by notification in the Official Gazette, modify any permit issued under this Act or make schemes for the transportation of goods and passengers and issue licences under such scheme for the promotion of development and efficiency in transportation--
title: Power to State Government to control road transport

chunk_text: (a) last mile connectivity;
title: Power to State Government to control road transport

chunk_text: (b) rural transport;
title: Power to State Government to control road transport

chunk_text: (c) reducing traffic congestion;
title: Power to State Government to control road transport

chunk_text: (d) improving urban transport;
title: Power to State Government to control road transport

chunk_text: (e) safety of road users;
title: Power to State Government to control road transport

chunk_text: (f) better utilisation of transportation assets;
title: Power to State Government to control road transport

chunk_text: (g) the enhancement of economic vitality of the area, through competitiveness, productivity and efficiency;
title: Power to State Government to control road transport

chunk_text: (h) the increase in the accessibility and mobility of people;
title: Power to State Government to control road transport

chunk_text: (i) the protection and enhancement of the environment;
title: Power to State Government to control road transport

chunk_text: (j) the promotion of energy conservation;
title: Power to State Government to control road transport

chunk_text: (k) improvement of the quality of life;
title: Power to State Government to control road transport

chunk_text: (l) enhance integration and connectivity of the transportation system, across and between modes of transport; and
title: Power to State Government to control road transport

chunk_text: (m) such other matters as the Central Government may deem fit.
title: Power to State Government to control road transport

chunk_text: (4) The scheme framed under sub-section (3), shall specify the fees to be charged, form of application and grant of a licence including the renewal, suspension, cancellation or modification of such licence.]
title: Power to State Government to control road transport

chunk_text: (1) The State Government shall, by notification in the Official Gazette, constitute for the State a State Transport Authority to exercise and discharge the powers and functions specified in sub-section (3), and shall in like manner constitute Regional Transport Authorities to exercise and discharge throughout such areas (in this Chapter referred to as regions) as may be specified in the notification, in respect of each Regional Transport Authority; the powers and functions conferred by or under this Chapter on such Authorities:
title: Transport Authorities

chunk_text: Provided that in the Union territories, the Administrator may abstain from constituting any Regional Transport Authority.
title: Transport Authorities

chunk_text: (2) A State Transport Authority or a Regional Transport Authority shall consist of a Chairman who has had judicial experience or experience as an appellate or a revisional authority or as an adjudicating authority competent to pass any order or take any decision under any law and in the case of a State Transport Authority, such other persons (whether officials or not), not being more than four and, in the case of a Regional Transport Authority, such other persons (whether officials or not), not being more than two, as the State Government may think fit to appoint; but no person who has any financial interest whether as proprietor, employee or otherwise in any transport undertaking shall be appointed, or continue to be, a member of a State or Regional Transport Authority, and, if any person being a member of any such Authority acquires a financial interest in any transport undertaking, he shall within four weeks of so doing, give notice in writing to the State Government of the acquisition of such interest and shall vacate office:
title: Transport Authorities

chunk_text: Provided that nothing in this sub-section shall prevent any of the members of the State Transport Authority or a Regional Transport Authority, as the case may be, to preside over a meeting of such Authority during the absence of the Chairman, notwithstanding that such member does not possess judicial experience or experience as an appellate or a revisional authority or as an adjudicating authority competent to pass any order or take any decision under any law:
title: Transport Authorities

chunk_text: Provided further that the State Government may,--
title: Transport Authorities

chunk_text: (i) where it considers necessary or expedient so to do, constitute the State Transport Authority or a Regional Transport Authority for any region so as to consist of only one member who shall be an official with judicial experience or experience as an appellate or a revisional authority or as an adjudicating authority competent to pass any order or take any decision under any law;
title: Transport Authorities

chunk_text: (ii) by rules made in this behalf, provide for the transaction of business of such authorities in the absence of the Chairman or any other member and specify the circumstances under which, and the manner in which, such business could be so transacted:
title: Transport Authorities

chunk_text: Provided also that nothing in this sub-section shall be construed as debarring an official (other than an official connected directly with the management or operation of a transport undertaking) from being appointed or continuing as a member of any such authority merely by reason of the fact that the Government employing the official has, or acquires, any financial interest in a transport undertaking.
title: Transport Authorities

chunk_text: (3) The State Transport Authority and every Regional Transport Authority shall give effect to any directions issued under section 67 and the State Transport Authority shall, subject to such directions and save as otherwise provided by or under this Act, exercise and discharge throughout the State the following powers and functions, namely:--
title: Transport Authorities

chunk_text: (a) to co-ordinate and regulate the activities and policies of the Regional Transport Authorities, if any, of the State;
title: Transport Authorities

chunk_text: (b) to perform the duties of a Regional Transport Authority where there is no such Authority and, if it thinks fit or if so required by a Regional Transport Authority, to perform those duties in respect of any route common to two or more regions;
title: Transport Authorities

chunk_text: (c) to settle all disputes and decide all matters on which differences of opinion arise between Regional Transport Authorities; and
title: Transport Authorities

chunk_text: 1[(ca) Government to formulate routes for plying stage carriages;]
title: Transport Authorities

chunk_text: (d) to discharge such other functions as may be prescribed.
title: Transport Authorities

chunk_text: (4) For the purpose of exercising and discharging the powers and functions specified in sub-section (3), a State Transport Authority may, subject to such conditions as may be prescribed, issue directions to any Regional Transport Authority, and the Regional Transport Authority shall, in the discharge of its functions under this Act, give effect to and be guided by such directions.
title: Transport Authorities

chunk_text: (5) The State Transport Authority and any Regional Transport Authority, if authorised in this behalf by rules made under section 96, may delegate such of its powers and functions to such authority or person subject to such restrictions, limitations and conditions as may be prescribed by the said rules.
title: Transport Authorities

chunk_text: (1) Every application for a permit shall be made to the Regional Transport Authority of the region in which it is proposed to use the vehicle or vehicles:
title: General provision as to applications for permits

chunk_text: Provided that if it is proposed to use the vehicle or vehicles in two or more regions lying within the same State, the application shall be made to the Regional Transport Authority of the region in which the major portion of the proposed route or area lies, and in case the portion of the proposed route or area in each of the regions is approximately equal, to the Regional Transport Authority of the region in which it is proposed to keep the vehicle or vehicles:
title: General provision as to applications for permits

chunk_text: Provided further that if it is proposed to use the vehicle or vehicles in two or more regions lying in different States, the application shall be made to the Regional Transport Authority of the region in which the applicant resides or has his principal place of business.
title: General provision as to applications for permits

chunk_text: (2) Notwithstanding anything contained in sub-section (1), the State Government may, by notification in the Official Gazette, direct that in the case of any vehicle or vehicles proposed to be used in two or more regions lying in different States, the application under that sub-section shall be made to the State Transport Authority of the region in which the applicant resides or has his principal place of business.
title: General provision as to applications for permits

chunk_text: (1) An application for a permit in respect of a stage carriage (in this Chapter referred to as a stage carriage permit) or as a reserve stage carriage shall, as far as may be, contain the following particulars, namely:--
title: Application for stage carriage permit

chunk_text: (a) the route or routes or the area or areas to which the application relates;
title: Application for stage carriage permit

chunk_text: (b) the type and seating capacity of each such vehicle;
title: Application for stage carriage permit

chunk_text: (c) the minimum and maximum number of daily trips proposed to be provided and the time-table of the normal trips.
title: Application for stage carriage permit

chunk_text: Explanation.--For the purposes of this section, section 72, section 80 and section 102, "trip" means a single journey from one point to another, and every return journey shall be deemed to be a separate trip;
title: Application for stage carriage permit

chunk_text: (d) the number of vehicles intended to be kept in reserve to maintain the service and to provide for special occasions;
title: Application for stage carriage permit

chunk_text: (e) the arrangements intended to be made for the housing, maintenance and repair of the vehicles, for the comfort and convenience of passengers and for the storage and safe custody of luggage;
title: Application for stage carriage permit

chunk_text: (f) such other matters as may be prescribed.
title: Application for stage carriage permit

chunk_text: (2) An application referred to in sub-section (1) shall be accompanied by such documents as may be prescribed.
title: Application for stage carriage permit

chunk_text: (1) A Regional Transport Authority shall, while considering an application for a stage carriage permit, have regard to the objects of this Act:
title: Procedure of Regional Transport Authority in considering application for stage carriage permit
Procedure of Regional Transport Authority in considering application for stage carriage permit

chunk_text: (2) A Regional Transport Authority shall refuse to grant a stage carriage permit if it appears from any time-table furnished that the provisions of this Act relating to the speed at which vehicles may be driven are likely to be contravened:
title: Procedure of Regional Transport Authority in considering application for stage carriage permit

chunk_text: Provided that before such refusal an opportunity shall be given to the applicant to amend the timetable so as to conform to the said provisions.
title: Procedure of Regional Transport Authority in considering application for stage carriage permit

chunk_text: (3) (a) The State Government shall, if so directed by the Central Government having regard to the number of vehicles, road conditions and other relevant matters, by notification in the Official Gazette, direct a State Transport Authority and a Regional Transport Authority to limit the number of stage carriages generally or of any specified type, as may be fixed and specified in the notification, operating on city routes in towns with a population of not less than five lakhs.
title: Procedure of Regional Transport Authority in considering application for stage carriage permit

chunk_text: (b) Where the number of stage carriages are fixed under clause (a), the Government of the State shall reserve in the State certain percentage of stage carriage permits for the scheduled castes and the scheduled tribes in the same ratio as in the case of appointments made by direct recruitment to public services in the State.
title: Procedure of Regional Transport Authority in considering application for stage carriage permit

chunk_text: (c) Where the number of stage carriages are fixed under clause (a), the Regional Transport Authority shall reserve such number of permits for the scheduled castes and the scheduled tribes as may be fixed by the State Government under sub-clause (b).
title: Procedure of Regional Transport Authority in considering application for stage carriage permit

chunk_text: (d) After reserving such number of permits as is referred to in clause (c), the Regional Transport Authority shall in considering an application have regard to the following matters, namely:--
title: Procedure of Regional Transport Authority in considering application for stage carriage permit

chunk_text: (i) financial stability of the applicant;
title: Procedure of Regional Transport Authority in considering application for stage carriage permit

chunk_text: (ii) satisfactory performance as a stage carriage operator including payment of tax if the applicant is or has been an operator of stage carriage service; and
title: Procedure of Regional Transport Authority in considering application for stage carriage permit

chunk_text: (iii) such other matters as may be prescribed by the State Government:
title: Procedure of Regional Transport Authority in considering application for stage carriage permit

chunk_text: Provided that, other conditions being equal, preference shall be given to applications for permits from--
title: Procedure of Regional Transport Authority in considering application for stage carriage permit

chunk_text: (i) State transport undertakings;
title: Procedure of Regional Transport Authority in considering application for stage carriage permit

chunk_text: (ii) co-operative societies registered or deemed to have been registered under any enactment for the time being in force; 2***
title: Procedure of Regional Transport Authority in considering application for stage carriage permit

chunk_text: (iii) ex-servicemen; 3[or]
title: Procedure of Regional Transport Authority in considering application for stage carriage permit

chunk_text: 3[(iv) any other class or category of persons, as the State Government may, for reasons to be recorded in writing consider necessary.]
title: Procedure of Regional Transport Authority in considering application for stage carriage permit
Procedure of Regional Transport Authority in considering application for stage carriage permit

chunk_text: Explanation.--For the purposes of this section "company" means any body corporate, and includes a firm or other association of individuals; and "director", in relation to a firm, means a partner in the firm.
title: Procedure of Regional Transport Authority in considering application for stage carriage permit

chunk_text: STATE AMENDMENT
title: Procedure of Regional Transport Authority in considering application for stage carriage permit

chunk_text: Kerala--
title: Procedure of Regional Transport Authority in considering application for stage carriage permit

chunk_text: Amendment of section 71.--In section 71 of the Motor Vehicles Act, 1988 (Central Act 59 of 1988), (hereinafter referred to as the principal Act), in sub-section (4).--
title: Procedure of Regional Transport Authority in considering application for stage carriage permit

chunk_text: (i) for the words "five" and “ten", the words "ten" and "fifty" shall, respectively, be substituted;
title: Procedure of Regional Transport Authority in considering application for stage carriage permit

chunk_text: (ii) for the words "any company", the words "any co-operative society or to any company" shall be substituted.
title: Procedure of Regional Transport Authority in considering application for stage carriage permit

chunk_text: [Vide Kerala Act 12 of 1993, sec. 2.]
title: Procedure of Regional Transport Authority in considering application for stage carriage permit

chunk_text: (1) Subject to the provisions of section 71, a Regional Transport Authority may, on an application made to it under section 70, grant a stage carriage permit in accordance with the application or with such modifications as it deems fit or refuse to grant such a permit:
title: Grant of stage carriage permits

chunk_text: Provided that no such permit shall be granted in respect of any route or area not specified in the application.
title: Grant of stage carriage permits

chunk_text: (2) The Regional Transport Authority, if it decides to grant a stage carriage permit, may grant the permit for a stage carriage of a specified description and may, subject to any rules that may be made under this Act, attach to the permit any one or more of the following conditions, namely:--
title: Grant of stage carriage permits

chunk_text: (i) that the vehicles shall be used only in a specified area, or on a specified route or routes;
title: Grant of stage carriage permits

chunk_text: (ii) that the operation of the stage carriage shall be commenced with effect from a specified date;
title: Grant of stage carriage permits

chunk_text: (iii) the minimum and maximum number of daily trips to be provided in relation to any route or area generally or on specified days and occasions;
title: Grant of stage carriage permits

chunk_text: (iv) that copies of the time-table of the stage carriage approved by the Regional Transport Authority shall be exhibited on the vehicles and at specified stands and halts on the route or within the area;
title: Grant of stage carriage permits

chunk_text: (v) that the stage carriage shall be operated within such margins of deviation from the approved time-table as the Regional Transport Authority may from time to time specify;
title: Grant of stage carriage permits

chunk_text: (vi) that within municipal limits and such other areas and places as may be prescribed, passengers or goods shall not be taken up or set down except at specified points;
title: Grant of stage carriage permits

chunk_text: (vii) the maximum number of passengers and the maximum weight of luggage that may be carried on the stage carriage, either generally or on specified occasions or at specified times and seasons;
title: Grant of stage carriage permits

chunk_text: (viii) the weight and nature of passengers' luggage that shall be carried free of charge, the total weight of luggage that may be carried in relation to each passenger, and the arrangements that shall be made for the carriage of luggage without causing inconvenience to passengers;
title: Grant of stage carriage permits

chunk_text: (ix) the rate of charge that may be levied for passengers' luggage in excess of the free allowance;
title: Grant of stage carriage permits

chunk_text: (x) that vehicles of a specified type fitted with body conforming to approved specifications shall be used:
title: Grant of stage carriage permits

chunk_text: Provided that the attachment of this condition to a permit shall not prevent the continued use, for a period of two years from the date of publication of the approved specifications, of any vehicle operating on that date;
title: Grant of stage carriage permits

chunk_text: (xi) that specified standards of comfort and cleanliness shall be maintained in the vehicles;
title: Grant of stage carriage permits

chunk_text: (xii) the conditions subject to which goods may be carried in the stage carriage in addition to or to the exclusion of passengers;
title: Grant of stage carriage permits

chunk_text: (xiii) that fares shall be charged in accordance with the approved fare table;
title: Grant of stage carriage permits

chunk_text: (xiv) that a copy of, or extract from, the fare table approved by the Regional Transport Authority and particulars of any special fares or rates of fares so approved for particular occasions shall be exhibited on the stage carriage and at specified stands and halts;
title: Grant of stage carriage permits

chunk_text: (xv) that tickets bearing specified particulars shall be issued to passengers and shall show the fares actually charged and that records of tickets issued shall be kept in a specified manner;
title: Grant of stage carriage permits

chunk_text: (xvi) that mails shall be carried on the vehicle subject to such conditions (including conditions as to the time in which mails are to be carried and the charges which may be levied) as may be specified;
title: Grant of stage carriage permits

chunk_text: (xvii) the vehicles to be kept as reserve by the holder of the permit to maintain the operation and to provide for special occasions;
title: Grant of stage carriage permits

chunk_text: (xviii) the conditions subject to which vehicle may be used as a contract carriage;
title: Grant of stage carriage permits

chunk_text: (xix) that specified arrangements shall be made for the housing, maintenance and repair of vehicle;
title: Grant of stage carriage permits

chunk_text: (xx) that any specified bus station or shelter maintained by Government or a local authority shall be used and that any specified rent or fee shall be paid for such use;
title: Grant of stage carriage permits

chunk_text: (xxi) that the conditions of the permit shall not be departed from, save with the approval of the Regional Transport Authority;
title: Grant of stage carriage permits

chunk_text: (xxii) that the Regional Transport Authority may, after giving notice of not less than one month,--
title: Grant of stage carriage permits

chunk_text: (a) vary the conditions of the permit;
title: Grant of stage carriage permits

chunk_text: (b) attach to the permit further conditions:
title: Grant of stage carriage permits

chunk_text: Provided that the conditions specified in pursuance of clause (i) shall not be varied so as to alter the distance covered by the original route by more than 24 kilometers, and any variation within such limits shall be made only after the Regional Transport Authority is satisfied that such variation will serve the convenience of the public and that it is not expedient to grant a separate permit in respect of the original route as so varied or any part thereof;
title: Grant of stage carriage permits

chunk_text: (xxiii) that the holder of a permit shall furnish to the Regional Transport Authority such periodical returns, statistics and other information as the State Government may from time to time prescribe;
title: Grant of stage carriage permits

chunk_text: (xxiv) any other conditions which may be prescribed.
title: Grant of stage carriage permits

chunk_text: 1[Provided that the Regional Transport Authority may waive any such condition for a stage carriage permit operating in a rural area, as it deems fit.]
title: Grant of stage carriage permits

chunk_text: An application for a permit in respect of a contract carriage (in this Chapter referred to as a contract carriage permit) shall contain the following particulars, namely:--
title: Application for contract carriage permit

chunk_text: (a) the type and seating capacity of the vehicle;
title: Application for contract carriage permit

chunk_text: (b) the area for which the permit is required;
title: Application for contract carriage permit

chunk_text: (c) any other particulars which may be prescribed.
title: Application for contract carriage permit

chunk_text: (1) Subject to the provisions of sub-section (3), a Regional Transport Authority may, on an application made to it under section 73, grant a contract carriage permit in accordance with the application or with such modifications as it deems fit or refuse to grant such a permit:
title: Grant of contract carriage permit

chunk_text: Provided that no such permit shall be granted in respect of any area not specified in the application.
title: Grant of contract carriage permit

chunk_text: (2) The Regional Transport Authority, if it decides to grant a contract carriage permit, may, subject to any rules that may be made under this Act, attach to the permit any one or more of the following conditions, namely:--
title: Grant of contract carriage permit

chunk_text: (i) that the vehicles shall be used only in a specified area or on a specified route or routes;
title: Grant of contract carriage permit

chunk_text: (ii) that except in accordance with specified conditions, no contract of hiring, other than an extension or modification of a subsisting contract, may be entered into outside the specified area;
title: Grant of contract carriage permit

chunk_text: (iii) the maximum number of passengers and the maximum weight of luggage that may be carried on the vehicles, either generally or on specified occasions or at specified times and seasons;
title: Grant of contract carriage permit

chunk_text: (iv) the conditions subject to which goods may be carried in any contract carriage in addition to, or to the exclusion of, passengers;
title: Grant of contract carriage permit

chunk_text: (v) that, in the case of motor cabs, specified fares or rates of fares shall be charged and a copy of the fare table shall be exhibited on the vehicle;
title: Grant of contract carriage permit

chunk_text: (vi) that, in the case of vehicles other than motor cabs, specified rates of hiring not exceeding specified maximum shall be charged;
title: Grant of contract carriage permit

chunk_text: (vii) that, in the case of motor cabs, a special weight of passengers' luggage shall be carried free of charge, and that the charge, if any, for any luggage in excess thereof shall be at a specified rate;
title: Grant of contract carriage permit

chunk_text: (viii) that, in the case of motor cabs, a taximeter shall be fitted and maintained in proper working order, if prescribed;
title: Grant of contract carriage permit

chunk_text: (ix) that the Regional Transport Authority may, after giving notice of not less than one month,--
title: Grant of contract carriage permit

chunk_text: (a) vary the conditions of the permit;
title: Grant of contract carriage permit

chunk_text: (b) attach to the permit further conditions;
title: Grant of contract carriage permit

chunk_text: (x) that the conditions of permit shall not be departed from save with the approval of the Regional Transport Authority;
title: Grant of contract carriage permit

chunk_text: (xi) that specified standards of comfort and cleanliness shall be maintained in the vehicles;
title: Grant of contract carriage permit

chunk_text: (xii) that, except in the circumstances of exceptional nature, the plying of the vehicle or carrying of the passengers shall not be refused;
title: Grant of contract carriage permit

chunk_text: (xiii) any other conditions which may be prescribed.
title: Grant of contract carriage permit

chunk_text: 1[Provided that the Regional Transport Authority may in the interests of last mile connectivity waive any such condition in respect of any such types of vehicles as may be specified by the Central Government.]
title: Grant of contract carriage permit

chunk_text: (3) (a) The State Government shall, if so directed by the Central Government, having regard to the number of vehicles, road conditions and other relevant matters, by notification in the Official Gazette, direct a State Transport Authority and a Regional Transport Authority to limit the number of contract carriages generally or of any specified type, as may be fixed and specified in the notification, operating on city routes in towns with a population of not less than five lakhs.
title: Grant of contract carriage permit

chunk_text: (b) Where the number of contract carriages are fixed under clause (a), the Regional Transport Authority shall, in considering an application for the grant of permit in respect of any such contract carriage, have regard to the following matters, namely:--
title: Grant of contract carriage permit

chunk_text: (i) financial stability of the applicant;
title: Grant of contract carriage permit

chunk_text: (ii) satisfactory performance as a contract carriage operator including payment of tax if the applicant is or has been an operator of contract carriages; and
title: Grant of contract carriage permit

chunk_text: (iii) such other matters as may be prescribed by the State Government:
title: Grant of contract carriage permit

chunk_text: Provided that, other conditions being equal, preference shall be given to applications for permits from--
title: Grant of contract carriage permit

chunk_text: (i) the India Tourism Development Corporation;
title: Grant of contract carriage permit

chunk_text: (ii) State Tourism Development Corporations;
title: Grant of contract carriage permit

chunk_text: (iii) State Tourism Departments;
title: Grant of contract carriage permit

chunk_text: iv) State transport undertakings;
title: Grant of contract carriage permit

chunk_text: (v) co-operative societies registered or deemed to have been registered under any enactment for the time being in force;
title: Grant of contract carriage permit

chunk_text: (vi) ex-servicemen;
title: Grant of contract carriage permit

chunk_text: 1[(vii) self-help groups.]
title: Grant of contract carriage permit

chunk_text: (1) The Central Government may, by notification in the Official Gazette, make a scheme for the purpose of regulating the business of renting of 1[motor cabs or motor cycles to persons desiring to drive either by themselves or through drivers, motor cabs or motor cycles] for their own use and for matters connected therewith.
title: Scheme for renting of motor cabs

chunk_text: (2) A scheme made under sub-section (1) may provide for all or any of the following matters, namely:--
title: Scheme for renting of motor cabs

chunk_text: (a) licensing of operators under the scheme including grant, renewal and revocation of such licences;
title: Scheme for renting of motor cabs

chunk_text: (b) form of application and form of licences and the particulars to be contained therein;
title: Scheme for renting of motor cabs

chunk_text: (c) fee to be paid with the application for such licences;
title: Scheme for renting of motor cabs

chunk_text: (d) the authorities to which the application shall be made;
title: Scheme for renting of motor cabs

chunk_text: (e) condition subject to which such licences may be granted, renewed or revoked;
title: Scheme for renting of motor cabs

chunk_text: (f) appeals against orders of refusal to grant or renew such licences and appeals against orders revoking such licences;
title: Scheme for renting of motor cabs

chunk_text: (g) conditions subject to which motor cabs may be rented;
title: Scheme for renting of motor cabs

chunk_text: (h) maintenance of records and inspection of such records;
title: Scheme for renting of motor cabs

chunk_text: (i) such other matters as may be necessary to carry out the purposes of this section.
title: Scheme for renting of motor cabs

chunk_text: (1) A Regional Transport Authority may, on an application made to it, grant a private service vehicle permit in accordance with the application or with such modification as it deems fit or refuse to grant such permit:
title: Application for private service vehicle permit

chunk_text: Provided that no such permit shall be granted in respect of any area or route not specified in the application.
title: Application for private service vehicle permit

chunk_text: (2) An application for a permit to use a motor vehicle as a private service vehicle shall contain the following particulars, namely:--
title: Application for private service vehicle permit

chunk_text: (a) type and seating capacity of the vehicle;
title: Application for private service vehicle permit

chunk_text: (b) the area or the route or routes to which the application relates;
title: Application for private service vehicle permit

chunk_text: (c) the manner in which it is claimed that the purpose of carrying persons otherwise than for hire or reward or in connection with the trade or business carried on by the applicant will be served by the vehicle; and
title: Application for private service vehicle permit

chunk_text: (d) any other particulars which may be prescribed.
title: Application for private service vehicle permit

chunk_text: (3) The Regional Transport Authority if it decides to grant the permit may, subject to any rules that may be made under this Act, attach to the permit any one or more of the following conditions, namely:--
title: Application for private service vehicle permit

chunk_text: (i) that the vehicle be used only in a specified area or on a specified route or routes;
title: Application for private service vehicle permit

chunk_text: (ii) the maximum number of persons and the maximum weight of luggage that may be carried;
title: Application for private service vehicle permit

chunk_text: (iii) that the Regional Transport Authority may, after giving notice of not less than one month--
title: Application for private service vehicle permit

chunk_text: (a) vary the conditions of the permit;
title: Application for private service vehicle permit

chunk_text: (b) attach to the permit further conditions;
title: Application for private service vehicle permit

chunk_text: (iv) that the conditions of permit shall not be departed from, save with the approval of the Regional Transport Authority;
title: Application for private service vehicle permit

chunk_text: (v) that specified standards of comforts and cleanliness shall be maintained in the vehicle;
title: Application for private service vehicle permit

chunk_text: (vi) that the holder of the permit shall furnish to the Regional Transport Authority such periodical returns, statistics and other information as the State Government may, from time to time, specify; and
title: Application for private service vehicle permit

chunk_text: (vii) such other conditions as may be prescribed.
title: Application for private service vehicle permit

chunk_text: An application for a permit to use a motor vehicle for the carriage of goods for hire or reward or for the carriage of goods for or in connection with a trade or business carried on by the applicant (in this Chapter referred to as a goods carriage permit) shall, as far as may be, contain the following particulars, namely:--
title: Application for goods carriage permit

chunk_text: (a) the area or the route or routes to which the application relates;
title: Application for goods carriage permit

chunk_text: (b) the type and capacity of the vehicle;
title: Application for goods carriage permit

chunk_text: (c) the nature of the goods it is proposed to carry;
title: Application for goods carriage permit

chunk_text: (d) the arrangements intended to be made for the housing, maintenance and repair of the vehicle and for the storage and safe custody of the goods;
title: Application for goods carriage permit

chunk_text: (e) such particulars as the Regional Transport Authority may require with respect to any business as a carrier of goods for hire or reward carried on by the applicant at any time before the making of the application, and of the rates charged by the applicant;
title: Application for goods carriage permit

chunk_text: (f) particulars of any agreement, or arrangement, affecting in any material respect the provision within the region of the Regional Transport Authority of facilities for the transport of goods for hire or reward, entered into by the applicant with any other person by whom such facilities are provided, whether within or without the region;
title: Application for goods carriage permit

chunk_text: (g) any other particulars which may be prescribed.
title: Application for goods carriage permit

chunk_text: A Regional Transport Authority shall, in considering an application for a goods carriage permit, have regard to the following matters, namely:--
title: Consideration of application for goods carriage permit

chunk_text: (a) the nature of the goods to be carried with special reference to their dangerous or hazardous nature to human life;
title: Consideration of application for goods carriage permit

chunk_text: (b) the nature of the chemicals or explosives to be carried with special reference to the safety to human life.
title: Consideration of application for goods carriage permit

chunk_text: (1) A Regional Transport Authority may, on an application made to it under section 77, grant a goods carriage permit to be valid throughout the State or in accordance with the application or with such modifications as it deems fit or refuse to grant such a permit:
title: Grant of goods carriage permit

chunk_text: Provided that no such permit shall be granted in respect of any area or route not specified in the application.
title: Grant of goods carriage permit

chunk_text: (2) The Regional Transport Authority, if it decides to grant a goods carriage permit, may grant the permit and may, subject to any rules that may be made under this Act, attach to the permit any one or more of the following conditions, namely:--
title: Grant of goods carriage permit

chunk_text: (i) that the vehicle shall be used only in a specified area or on a specified route or routes;
title: Grant of goods carriage permit

chunk_text: (ii) that the gross vehicle weight of any vehicle used shall not exceed a specified maximum;
title: Grant of goods carriage permit

chunk_text: (iii) that goods of a specified nature shall not be carried;
title: Grant of goods carriage permit

chunk_text: (iv) that goods shall be carried at specified rates;
title: Grant of goods carriage permit

chunk_text: (v) that specified arrangement shall be made for the housing, maintenance and repair of the vehicle and the storage and safe custody of the goods carried;
title: Grant of goods carriage permit

chunk_text: (vi) that the holder of the permit shall furnish to the Regional Transport Authority such periodical returns, statistics and other information as the State Government may, from time to time, prescribe;
title: Grant of goods carriage permit

chunk_text: (vii) that the Regional Transport Authority may, after giving notice of not less than one month,--
title: Grant of goods carriage permit

chunk_text: (a) vary the conditions of the permit;
title: Grant of goods carriage permit

chunk_text: (b) attach to the permit further conditions;
title: Grant of goods carriage permit

chunk_text: (viii) that the conditions of the permit shall not be departed from, save with the approval of the Regional Transport Authority;
title: Grant of goods carriage permit

chunk_text: (ix) any other conditions which may be prescribed.
title: Grant of goods carriage permit

chunk_text: (3) The conditions referred to in sub-section (2) may include conditions relating to the packaging and carriage of goods of dangerous or hazardous nature to human life.
title: Grant of goods carriage permit

chunk_text: (1) An application for a permit of any kind may be made at any time.
title: Procedure in applying for and granting permits

chunk_text: (2) A 1[Regional Transport Authority, State Transport Authority or any prescribed authority referred to in sub-section (1) of section 66] shall not ordinarily refuse to grant an application for permit of any kind made at any time under this Act:
title: Procedure in applying for and granting permits

chunk_text: Provided that the 1[Regional Transport Authority, State Transport Authority or any prescribed authority referred to in sub-section (1) of section 66] may summarily refuse the application if the grant of any permit in accordance with the application would have the effect of increasing the number of stage carriages as fixed and specified in a notification in the Official Gazette under clause (a) of sub-section (3) of section 71 or of contract carriages as fixed and specified in a notification in the Official Gazette under clause (a) of sub-section (3) of section 74:
title: Procedure in applying for and granting permits

chunk_text: Provided further that where a 2[Regional Transport Authority, State Transport Authority or any prescribed authority referred to in sub-section (1) of section 66] refuses an application for the grant of a permit of any kind under this Act, it shall give to the applicant in writing its reasons for the refusal of the same and an opportunity of being heard in the matter.
title: Procedure in applying for and granting permits

chunk_text: (3) An application to vary the conditions of any permit, other than a temporary permit, by the inclusion of a new route or routes of a new area or by altering the route or routes or area covered by it, or in the case of a stage carriage permit by increasing the number of trips above the specified maximum or by the variation, extension or curtailment of the route or routes or the area specified in the permit shall be treated as an application for the grant of a new permit:
title: Procedure in applying for and granting permits

chunk_text: Provided that it shall not be necessary so to treat an application made by the holder of stage carriage permit who provides the only service on any route to increase the frequency of the service so provided without any increase in the number of vehicles:
title: Procedure in applying for and granting permits

chunk_text: Provided further that,--
title: Procedure in applying for and granting permits

chunk_text: (i) in the case of variation, the termini shall not be altered and the distance covered by the variation shall not exceed twenty-four kilometres;
title: Procedure in applying for and granting permits

chunk_text: (ii) in the case of extension, the distance covered by extension shall not exceed twenty-four kilometres from the termini,
title: Procedure in applying for and granting permits

chunk_text: and any such variation or extension within such limits shall be made only after the transport authority is satisfied that such variation will serve the convenience of the public and that it is not expedient to grant a separate permit in respect of the original route as so varied or extended or any part thereof.
title: Procedure in applying for and granting permits

chunk_text: (4) A 2[Regional Transport Authority, State Transport Authority or any prescribed authority referred to in sub-section (1) of section 66] may, before such date as may be specified by it in this behalf, replace any permit granted by it before the said date by a fresh permit conforming to the provisions of section 72 or section 74 or section 76 or section 79, as the case may be, and the fresh permit shall be valid for the same route or routes or the same area for which the replaced permit was valid:
title: Procedure in applying for and granting permits

chunk_text: Provided that no condition other than a condition which was already attached to the replaced permit or which could have been attached thereto under the law in force when that permit was granted shall be attached to the fresh permit except with the consent in writing of the holder of the permit.
title: Procedure in applying for and granting permits

chunk_text: (5) Notwithstanding anything contained in section 81, a permit issued under the provisions of sub-section (4) shall be effective without renewal for the remainder of the period during which the replaced permit would have been so effective.
title: Procedure in applying for and granting permits

chunk_text: (1) A permit other than a temporary permit issued under section 87 or a special permit issued under sub-section (8) of section 88 shall be effective 1[from the date of issuance or renewal thereof] for a period of five years:
title: Duration and renewal of permits

chunk_text: Provided that where the permit is countersigned under sub-section (1) of section 88, such countersignature shall remain effective without renewal for such period so as to synchronise with the validity of the primary permit.
title: Duration and renewal of permits

chunk_text: (2) A permit may be renewed on an application made not less than fifteen days before the date of its expiry.
title: Duration and renewal of permits

chunk_text: (3) Notwithstanding anything contained in sub-section (2), the Regional Transport Authority or the State Transport Authority, as the case may be, may entertain an application for the renewal of a permit after the last date specified in that sub-section if it is satisfied that the applicant was prevented by good and sufficient cause from making an application within the time specified.
title: Duration and renewal of permits

chunk_text: (4) The Regional Transport Authority or the State Transport Authority, as the case may be, may reject an application for the renewal of a permit on one or more of the following grounds, namely:--
title: Duration and renewal of permits

chunk_text: (a) the financial condition of the applicant as evidenced by insolvency, or decrees for payment of debts remaining unsatisfied for a period of thirty days, prior to the date of consideration of the application;
title: Duration and renewal of permits

chunk_text: (b) the applicant had been punished twice or more for any of the following offences within twelve months reckoned from fifteen days prior to the date of consideration of the application committed as a result of the operation of a stage carriage service by the applicant, namely:
title: Duration and renewal of permits

chunk_text: (i) plying any vehicle--
title: Duration and renewal of permits

chunk_text: (1) without payment of tax due on such vehicle;
title: Duration and renewal of permits

chunk_text: (2) without payment of tax during the grace period allowed for payment of such tax and then stop the plying of such vehicle;
title: Duration and renewal of permits

chunk_text: (3) on any unauthorised route;
title: Duration and renewal of permits

chunk_text: (ii) making unauthorised trips:
title: Duration and renewal of permits

chunk_text: Provided that in computing the number of punishments for the purpose of clause (b), any punishment stayed by the order of an appellate authority shall not be taken into account:
title: Duration and renewal of permits

chunk_text: Provided further that no application under this sub-section shall be rejected unless an opportunity of being heard is given to the applicant.
title: Duration and renewal of permits

chunk_text: (5) Where a permit has been renewed under this section after the expiry of the period thereof, such renewal shall have effect from the date of such expiry irrespective of whether or not a temporary permit has been granted under clause (d) of section 87, and where a temporary permit has been granted, the fee paid in respect of such temporary permit shall be refunded.
title: Duration and renewal of permits

chunk_text: (1) Save as provided in sub-section (2), a permit shall not be transferable from one person to another except with the permission of the transport authority which granted the permit and shall not, without such permission, operate to confer on any person to whom a vehicle covered by the permit is transferred any right to use that vehicle in the manner authorised by the permit.
title: Transfer of permit

chunk_text: (2) Where the holder of a permit dies, the person succeeding to the possession of the vehicle covered by the permit may, for a period of three months, use the permit as if it had been granted to himself:
title: Transfer of permit

chunk_text: Provided that such person has, within thirty days of the death of the holder, informed the transport authority which granted the permit of the death of the holder and of his own intention to use the permit:
title: Transfer of permit

chunk_text: Provided further that no permit shall be so used after the date on which it would have ceased to be effective without renewal in the hands of the deceased holder.
title: Transfer of permit

chunk_text: (3) The transport authority may, on application made to it within three months of the death of the holder of a permit, transfer the permit to the person succeeding to the possession of the vehicles covered by the permit:
title: Transfer of permit

chunk_text: Provided that the transport authority may entertain an application made after the expiry of the said period of three months if it is satisfied that the applicant was prevented by good and sufficient cause from making an application within the time specified.
title: Transfer of permit

chunk_text: The holder of a permit may, with the permission of the authority by which the permit was granted, replace any vehicle covered by the permit by any other vehicle of the same nature.
title: Replacement of vehicles

chunk_text: The following shall be conditions of every permit--
title: General conditions attaching to all permits

chunk_text: (a) that the vehicle to which the permit relates carries valid certificate of fitness issued under section 56 and is at all times so maintained as to comply with the requirements of this Act and the rules made thereunder;
title: General conditions attaching to all permits

chunk_text: (b) that the vehicle to which the permit relates is not driven at a speed exceeding the speed permitted under this Act;
title: General conditions attaching to all permits

chunk_text: (c) that any prohibition or restriction imposed and any fares or freight fixed by notification made under section 67 are observed in connection with the vehicle to which the permit relates;
title: General conditions attaching to all permits

chunk_text: (d) that the vehicle to which the permit relates is not driven in contravention of the provisions of section 5 or section 113;
title: General conditions attaching to all permits

chunk_text: (e) that the provisions of this Act limiting the hours of work of drivers are observed in connection with any vehicle or vehicles to which the permit relates;
title: General conditions attaching to all permits

chunk_text: (f) that the provisions of Chapters X, XI and XII so far as they apply to the holder of the permit are observed; and
title: General conditions attaching to all permits

chunk_text: (g) that the name and address of the operator shall be painted or otherwise firmly affixed to every vehicle to which the permit relates on the exterior of the body of that vehicle on both sides thereof in a colour or colours vividly contrasting to the colour of the vehicle centered as high as practicable below the window line in bold letters.
title: General conditions attaching to all permits

chunk_text: Every permit issued under this Act shall be complete in itself and shall contain all the necessary particulars of the permit and the conditions attached thereto.
title: General form of permits

chunk_text: (1) The transport authority which granted a permit may cancel the permit or may suspend it for such period as it thinks fit--
title: Cancellation and suspension of permits

chunk_text: (a) on the breach of any condition specified in section 84 or of any condition contained in the permit, or
title: Cancellation and suspension of permits

chunk_text: (b) if the holder of the permit uses or causes or allows a vehicle to be used in any manner not authorised by the permit, or
title: Cancellation and suspension of permits

chunk_text: (c) if the holder of the permit ceases to own the vehicle covered by the permit, or
title: Cancellation and suspension of permits

chunk_text: (d) if the holder of the permit has obtained the permit by fraud or misrepresentation, or
title: Cancellation and suspension of permits

chunk_text: (e) if the holder of the goods carriage permit, fails without reasonable cause, to use the vehicle for the purposes for which the permit was granted, or
title: Cancellation and suspension of permits

chunk_text: (f) if the holder of the permit acquires the citizenship of any foreign country:
title: Cancellation and suspension of permits

chunk_text: Provided that no permit shall be suspended or cancelled unless an opportunity has been given to the holder of the permit to furnish his explanation.
title: Cancellation and suspension of permits

chunk_text: (2) The transport authority may exercise the powers conferred on it under sub-section (1) in relation to a permit granted by any authority or person to whom power in this behalf has been delegated under sub-section (5) of section 68 as if the said permit was a permit granted by the transport authority.
title: Cancellation and suspension of permits

chunk_text: (3) Where a transport authority cancels or suspends a permit, it shall give to the holder in writing its reasons for the action taken.
title: Cancellation and suspension of permits

chunk_text: (4) The powers exercisable under sub-section (1) (other than the power to cancel a permit) by the transport authority which granted the permit may be exercised by any authority or person to whom such powers have been delegated under sub-section (5) of section 68.
title: Cancellation and suspension of permits

chunk_text: (5) Where a permit is liable to be cancelled or suspended under clause (a) or clause (b) or clause (e) of sub-section (1) and the transport authority is of opinion that having regard to the circumstances of the case, it would not be necessary or expedient so to cancel or suspend the permit if the holder of the permit agrees to pay a certain sum of money, then, notwithstanding anything contained in sub-section (1), the transport authority may, instead of cancelling or suspending the permit, as the case may be, recover from the holder of the permit the sum of money agreed upon.
title: Cancellation and suspension of permits

chunk_text: (6) The powers exercisable by the transport authority under sub-section (5) may, where an appeal has been preferred under section 89, be exercised also by the appellate authority.
title: Cancellation and suspension of permits

chunk_text: (7) In relation to a permit referred to in sub-section (9) of section 88, the powers exercisable under sub-section (1) (other than the power to cancel a permit) by the transport authority which granted the permit, may be exercised by any transport authority and any authority or persons to whom power in this behalf has been delegated under sub-section (5) of section 68, as if the said permit was a permit granted by any such authority or persons.
title: Cancellation and suspension of permits

chunk_text: (1) A Regional Transport Authority and the State Transport Authority may without following the procedure laid down in section 80, grant permits, to be effective for a limited period which shall, not in any case exceed four months, to authorise the use of a transport vehicle temporarily--
title: Temporary permits

chunk_text: (a) for the conveyance of passengers on special occasions such as to and from fairs and religious gatherings, or
title: Temporary permits

chunk_text: (b) for the purposes of a seasonal business, or
title: Temporary permits

chunk_text: (c) to meet a particular temporary need, or
title: Temporary permits

chunk_text: (d) pending decision on an application for the renewal of a permit,
title: Temporary permits

chunk_text: and may attach to any such permit such condition as it may think fit:
title: Temporary permits

chunk_text: Provided that a Regional Transport Authority or, as the case may be, State Transport Authority may, in the case of goods carriages, under the circumstances of an exceptional nature, and for reasons to be recorded in writing, grant a permit for a period exceeding four months, but not exceeding one year.
title: Temporary permits

chunk_text: (2) Notwithstanding anything contained in sub-section (1), a temporary permit may be granted thereunder in respect of any route or area where
title: Temporary permits

chunk_text: (i) no permit could be issued under section 72 or section 74 or section 76 or section 79 in respect of that route or area by reason of an order of a court or other competent authority restraining the issue of the same, for a period not exceeding the period for which the issue of the permit has been so restrained; or
title: Temporary permits

chunk_text: (ii) as a result of the suspension by a court or other competent authority of the permit of any vehicle in respect of that route or area, there is no transport vehicle of the same class with a valid permit in respect of that route or area, or there is no adequate number of such vehicles in respect of that route or area, for a period not exceeding the period of such suspension.
title: Temporary permits

chunk_text: Provided that the number of transport vehicles in respect of which temporary permits are so granted shall not exceed the number of vehicles in respect of which the issue of the permits have been restrained or, as the case may be, the permit has been suspended:
title: Temporary permits

chunk_text: (1) Except as may be otherwise prescribed, a permit granted by the Regional Transport Authority of any one region shall not be valid in any other region, unless the permit has been countersigned by the Regional Transport Authority of that other rigion, and a permit granted in any one State shall not be valid in any other State unless countersigned by the State Transport Authority of that other State or by the Regional Transport Authority concerned:
title: Validation of permits for use outside region in which granted

chunk_text: Provided that a goods carriage permit, granted by the Regional Transport Authority of any one region, for any area in any other region or regions within the same State shall be valid in that area without the countersignature of the Regional Transport Authority of the other region or of each of the other regions concerned:
title: Validation of permits for use outside region in which granted

chunk_text: Provided further that where both the starting point and the terminal point of a route are situate within the same State, but part of such route lies in any other State and the length of such part does not exceed sixteen kilometres, the permit shall be valid in the other State in respect of that part of the route which is in that other State notwithstanding that such permit has not been countersigned by the State Transport Authority or the Regional Transport Authority of that other State:
title: Validation of permits for use outside region in which granted

chunk_text: Provided also that--
title: Validation of permits for use outside region in which granted

chunk_text: (a) where a motor vehicle covered by a permit granted in one State is to be used for the purposes of defence in any other State, such vehicle shall display a certificate, in such form, and issued by such Authority, as the Central Government may, by notification in the Official Gazette, specify, to the effect that the vehicle shall be used for the period specified therein exclusively for the purposes of defence; and
title: Validation of permits for use outside region in which granted

chunk_text: (b) any such permit shall be valid in that other State notwithstanding that such permit has not been countersigned by the State Transport Authority or the Regional Transport Authority of that other State.
title: Validation of permits for use outside region in which granted

chunk_text: (2) Notwithstanding anything contained in sub-section (1), a permit granted or countersigned by a State Transport Authority shall be valid in the whole State or in such regions within the State as may be specified in the permit.
title: Validation of permits for use outside region in which granted

chunk_text: (3) A Regional Transport Authority when countersigning the permit may attach to the permit any condition which it might have imposed if it had granted the permit and may likewise vary any condition attached to the permit by the authority by which the permit was granted.
title: Validation of permits for use outside region in which granted

chunk_text: (4) The provisions of this Chapter relating to the grant, revocation and suspension of permits shall apply to the grant, revocation and suspension of countersignatures of permits:
title: Validation of permits for use outside region in which granted

chunk_text: Provided that it shall not be necessary to follow the procedure laid down in section 80 for the grant of countersignatures of permits, where the permits granted in any one State are required to be countersigned by the State Transport Authority of another State or by the Regional Transport Authority concerned as a result of any agreement arrived at between the States after complying with the requirements of sub-section (5).
title: Validation of permits for use outside region in which granted

chunk_text: (5) Every proposal to enter into an agreement between the States to fix the number of permits which is proposed to be granted or countersigned in respect of each route or area, shall be published by each of the State Governments concerned in the Official Gazette and in any one or more of the newspapers in regional language circulating in the area or route proposed to be covered by the agreement together with a notice of the date before which representations in connection therewith may be submitted, and the date not being less than thirty days from the date of publication in the Official Gazette, on which, and the authority by which, and the time and place at which, the proposal and any representation received in connection therewith will be considered.
title: Validation of permits for use outside region in which granted

chunk_text: (6) Every agreement arrived at between the States shall, in so far as it relates to the grant of countersignature of permits, be published by each of the State Governments concerned in the Official Gazette and in any one or more of the newspapers in the regional language circulating in the area or route covered by the agreement and the State Transport Authority of the State and the Regional Transport Authority concerned shall give effect to it.
title: Validation of permits for use outside region in which granted

chunk_text: (7) Notwithstanding anything contained in sub-section (1), a Regional Transport Authority of one region may issue a temporary permit under section 87 to be valid in another region or State with the concurrence, given generally or for the particular occasion, of the Regional Transport Authority of that other region or of the State Transport Authority of that other State, as the case may be.
title: Validation of permits for use outside region in which granted

chunk_text: (8) Notwithstanding anything contained in sub-section (1), but subject to any rules that may be made under this Act by the Central Government, the Regional Transport Authority of any one region or, as the case may be, the State Transport Authority, may, for the convenience of the public, 1[grant a special permit to any public service vehicle including any vehicle covered] by a permit issued under section 72 (including a reserve stage carriage) or under section 74 or under sub-section (9) of this section for carrying a passenger or passengers for hire or reward under a contract, express or implied, for the use of the vehicle as a whole without stopping to pick up or set down along the line of route passengers not included in the contract, and in every case where such special permit is granted, the Regional Transport Authority shall assign to the vehicle, for display thereon, a special distinguishing mark in the form and manner specified by the Central Government and such special permit shall be valid in any other region or State without the countersignature of the Regional Transport Authority of the other region or of the State Transport Authority of the other State, as the case may be.
title: Validation of permits for use outside region in which granted

chunk_text: (9) Notwithstanding anything contained in sub-section (1) but subject to any rules that may be made by the Central Government under sub-section (14), any State Transport Authority may, for the purpose of promoting tourism, grant permits in respect of tourist vehicles valid for the whole of India, or in such contiguous States not being less than three in number including the State in which the permit is issued as may be specified in such permit in accordance with the choice indicated in the application and the provisions of sections 73, 74, 80, 81, 82, 83, 84, 85, 86 2[clause (d) of sub-section (1) of section 87 and section 89] shall, as far as may be, apply in relation to such permits.
title: Validation of permits for use outside region in which granted
Validation of permits for use outside region in which granted

chunk_text: (11) The following shall be conditions of every permit granted under sub-section (9), namely:--
title: Validation of permits for use outside region in which granted

chunk_text: (i) every motor vehicle in respect of which such permit is granted shall conform to such description, requirement regarding the seating capacity, standards of comforts, amenities and other matters, as the Central Government may specify in this behalf;
title: Validation of permits for use outside region in which granted

chunk_text: (ii) every such motor vehicle shall be driven by a person having such qualifications and satisfying such conditions as may be specified by the Central Government; and
title: Validation of permits for use outside region in which granted

chunk_text: (iii) such other conditions as may be prescribed by the Central Government.
title: Validation of permits for use outside region in which granted

chunk_text: (12) Notwithstanding anything contained in sub-section (1), but, subject to the rules that may be made by the Central Government under sub-section (14), the appropriate authority may, for the purpose of encouraging long distance inter-State road transport, grant in a State, national permits in respect of goods carriages and the provisions of sections 69, 77, 79, 80, 81, 82, 83, 84, 85, 86 2[clause (d) of sub-section (1) of section 87 and section 89] shall, as far as may be, apply to or in relation to the grant of national permits.
title: Validation of permits for use outside region in which granted
Validation of permits for use outside region in which granted

chunk_text: (14) (a) The Central Government may make rules for carrying out the provisions of this section.
title: Validation of permits for use outside region in which granted

chunk_text: (b) In particular, and without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing power, such rules may provide for all or any of the following matters, namely:--
title: Validation of permits for use outside region in which granted
