chunk_text: (i) the authorisation fee payable for the issue of a permit referred to in sub-sections (9) and (12);
title: Validation of permits for use outside region in which granted

chunk_text: (ii) the fixation of the laden weight of the motor vehicle;
title: Validation of permits for use outside region in which granted

chunk_text: (iii) the distinguishing particulars or marks to be carried or exhibited in or on the motor vehicle;
title: Validation of permits for use outside region in which granted

chunk_text: (iv) the colour or colours in which the motor vehicle is to be painted;
title: Validation of permits for use outside region in which granted

chunk_text: (v) such other matters as the appropriate authority shall consider in granting a national permit. Explanation.-- In this section,--
title: Validation of permits for use outside region in which granted

chunk_text: (a) "appropriate authority", in relation to a national permit, means the authority which is authorised under this Act to grant a goods carriage permit;
title: Validation of permits for use outside region in which granted

chunk_text: (b) "authorisation fee" means the annual fee, not exceeding one thousand rupees, which may be charged by the appropriate authority of a State to enable a motor vehicle, covered by the permit referred to in sub-sections (9) and (12) to be used in other States subject to the payment of taxes or fees, if any, levied by the States concerned;
title: Validation of permits for use outside region in which granted

chunk_text: (c) "national permit" means a permit granted by the appropriate authority to goods carriages to operate throughout the territory of India or in such contiguous States, not being less than four in number, including the State in which the permit is issued as may be specified in such permit in accordance with the choice indicated in the application.
title: Validation of permits for use outside region in which granted

chunk_text: 1[88A. Power of Central Government to make schemes for national, multimodal and inter-State transport of passengers and goods.-- (1) Notwithstanding anything contained in this Act, the Central Government may, by notification in the Official Gazette, modify any permit issued under this Act or make schemes for national, multimodal and inter-State transportation of goods or passengers, and issue or modify licences under, such scheme for the following purposes, namely:--
title: Power of Central Government to make schemes for national, multimodal and inter-State transport of passengers and goods

chunk_text: (a) last mile connectivity;
title: Power of Central Government to make schemes for national, multimodal and inter-State transport of passengers and goods

chunk_text: (b) rural transport;
title: Power of Central Government to make schemes for national, multimodal and inter-State transport of passengers and goods

chunk_text: (c) improving the movement of freight, and logistics;
title: Power of Central Government to make schemes for national, multimodal and inter-State transport of passengers and goods

chunk_text: (d) better utilisation of transportation assets;
title: Power of Central Government to make schemes for national, multimodal and inter-State transport of passengers and goods

chunk_text: (e) the enhancement to the economic vitality of the area, especially by enabling competitiveness, productivity and efficiency;
title: Power of Central Government to make schemes for national, multimodal and inter-State transport of passengers and goods

chunk_text: (f) the increase in the accessibility and mobility of people;
title: Power of Central Government to make schemes for national, multimodal and inter-State transport of passengers and goods

chunk_text: (g) the protection and enhancement of the environment;
title: Power of Central Government to make schemes for national, multimodal and inter-State transport of passengers and goods

chunk_text: (h) the promotion of energy conservation;
title: Power of Central Government to make schemes for national, multimodal and inter-State transport of passengers and goods

chunk_text: (i) improvement of the quality of life;
title: Power of Central Government to make schemes for national, multimodal and inter-State transport of passengers and goods

chunk_text: (j) enhancement of the integration and connectivity of the transportation system, across and between modes of transport; and
title: Power of Central Government to make schemes for national, multimodal and inter-State transport of passengers and goods

chunk_text: (k) such other matters as the Central Government may deem fit:
title: Power of Central Government to make schemes for national, multimodal and inter-State transport of passengers and goods

chunk_text: Provided that the Central Government may, before taking any action under this sub-section seek concurrence of the State Governments.
title: Power of Central Government to make schemes for national, multimodal and inter-State transport of passengers and goods

chunk_text: (2) Notwithstanding anything contained in sub-section (1), two or more States may make schemes for the operation within such States for the inter-State transportation of goods or passengers:
title: Power of Central Government to make schemes for national, multimodal and inter-State transport of passengers and goods

chunk_text: Provided that in the event of any repugnancy between the schemes made by the Central Government under sub-section (1) and schemes made by two or more States under this sub-section, the schemes made under sub-section (1) shall prevail.]
title: Power of Central Government to make schemes for national, multimodal and inter-State transport of passengers and goods

chunk_text: (1) Any person--
title: Appeals

chunk_text: (a) aggrieved by the refusal of the State or a Regional Transport Authority to grant a permit, or by any condition attached to a permit granted to him, or
title: Appeals

chunk_text: (b) aggrieved by the revocation or suspension of the permit or by any variation of the conditions thereof, or
title: Appeals

chunk_text: (c) aggrieved by the refusal to transfer the permit under section 82, or
title: Appeals

chunk_text: (d) aggrieved by the refusal of the State or a Regional Transport Authority to countersign a permit, or by any condition attached to such countersignature, or
title: Appeals

chunk_text: (e) aggrieved by the refusal of renewal of a permit, or
title: Appeals

chunk_text: (f) aggrieved by the refusal to grant permission under section 83, or
title: Appeals

chunk_text: (g) aggrieved by any other order which may be prescribed, may, within the prescribed time and in the prescribed manner, appeal to the State Transport Appellate Tribunal constituted under sub-section (2), who shall, after giving such person and the original authority an opportunity of being heard, give a decision thereon which shall be final.
title: Appeals

chunk_text: 1[(2) The State Government shall constitute such number of Transport Appellate Tribunals as it thinks fit and each such Tribunal shall consist of a judicial officer who is not below the rank of a District Judge or who is qualified to be a Judge of the High Court and it shall exercise jurisdiction within such area as may be notified by that Government.]
title: Appeals

chunk_text: (3) Notwithstanding anything contained in sub-section (1) or sub- section (2), every appeal pending at the commencement of this Act, shall continue to be proceeded with and disposed of as if this Act had not been passed.
title: Appeals

chunk_text: Explanation.--For the removal of doubts, it is hereby declared that when any order is made by the State Transport Authority or the Regional Transport Authority in pursuance of a direction issued by the Inter-State Transport Commission under clause (c) of sub-section (2) of section 63A of the Motor Vehicles Act, 1939 (4 of 1939), as it stood immediately before the commencement of this Act, and any person feels aggrieved by such order on the ground that it is not in consonance with such direction, he may appeal under sub-section (1) to the State Transport Appellate Tribunal against such order but not against the direction so issued.
title: Appeals

chunk_text: The State Transport Appellate Tribunal may, on an application made to it, call for the record of any case in which an order has been made by a State Transport Authority or Regional Transport Authority against which no appeal lies, and if it appears to the State Transport Authority Appellate Tribunal that the order made by the State Transport Authority or Regional Transport Authority is improper or illegal, the State Transport Appellate Tribunal may pass such order in relation to the case as it deems fit and every such order shall be final:
title: Revision

chunk_text: Provided that the State Transport Appellate Tribunal shall not entertain any application from a person aggrieved by an order of a State Transport Authority or Regional Transport Authority, unless the application is made within thirty days from the date of the order:
title: Revision

chunk_text: Provided further that the State Transport Appellate Tribunal may entertain the application after the expiry of the said period of thirty days, if it is satisfied that the applicant was prevented by good and sufficient cause from making the application in time:
title: Revision

chunk_text: Provided also that the State Transport Appellate Tribunal shall not pass an order under this section prejudicial to any person without giving him a reasonable opportunity of being heard.
title: Revision

chunk_text: 1 [(1) The hours of work of any person engaged for operating a transport vehicle shall be such as provided in the Motor Transport Workers Act, 1961 (27 of 1961).]
title: Restriction of hours of work of drivers

chunk_text: (2) A State Government may, by notification in the Official Gazette, grant such exemptions from the provisions of sub-section (1) as it thinks fit, to meet cases of emergency or of delays by reason of circumstances which could not be foreseen.
title: Restriction of hours of work of drivers

chunk_text: (3) A State Government or, if authorised in this behalf by the State Government by rules made under section 96, the State or a Regional Transport Authority may require persons employing any person whose work is subject to any of the provisions of sub-section (1) to fix beforehand the hours of work of such persons so as to conform to those provisions, and may provide for the recording of the hours so fixed.
title: Restriction of hours of work of drivers

chunk_text: (4) No person shall work or shall cause or allow any other person to work outside the hours fixed or recorded for the work of such persons under sub-section (3).
title: Restriction of hours of work of drivers

chunk_text: (5) A State Government may prescribe the circumstances under which and the period during which the driver of a vehicle although not engaged in work is required to remain on or near the vehicle may be deemed to be an interval for rest within the meaning of sub-section (1).
title: Restriction of hours of work of drivers

chunk_text: Any contract for the conveyance of a passenger in a 1[transport vehicle, in respect of which a permit or licence] has been issued under this Chapter, shall, so far as it purports to negative or restrict the liability of any person in respect of any claim made against that person in respect of the death of, or bodily injury to, the passenger while being carried in, entering or alighting from the vehicle, or purports to impose any conditions with respect to the enforcement of any such liability, be void.
title: Voidance of contracts restrictive of liability

chunk_text: 1[Agent or canvasser or aggregator to obtain licence.]--(1) No person shall engage himself--
title: Agent or canvasser or aggregator to obtain licence

chunk_text: (i) as an agent or a canvasser, in the sale of tickets for travel by public service vehicles or in otherwise soliciting custom for such vehicles, or
title: Agent or canvasser or aggregator to obtain licence

chunk_text: (ii) as an agent in the business of collecting, forwarding or distributing goods carried by goods carriages,
title: Agent or canvasser or aggregator to obtain licence

chunk_text: 2[(iii) as an aggregator,]
title: Agent or canvasser or aggregator to obtain licence

chunk_text: unless he has obtained a licence from such authority and subject to such conditions as may be prescribed by the State Government.
title: Agent or canvasser or aggregator to obtain licence

chunk_text: 2[Provided that while issuing the licence to an aggregator the State Government may follow such guidelines as may be issued by the Central Government:
title: Agent or canvasser or aggregator to obtain licence

chunk_text: Provided further that every aggregator shall comply with the provisions of the Information Technology Act, 2000 (21 of 2000) and the rules and regulations made there under.]
title: Agent or canvasser or aggregator to obtain licence

chunk_text: (2) The conditions referred to in sub-section (1) may include all or any of the following matters, namely:--
title: Agent or canvasser or aggregator to obtain licence

chunk_text: (a) the period for which a licence may be granted or renewed;
title: Agent or canvasser or aggregator to obtain licence

chunk_text: (b) the fee payable for the issue or renewal of the licence;
title: Agent or canvasser or aggregator to obtain licence

chunk_text: (c) the deposit of security--
title: Agent or canvasser or aggregator to obtain licence

chunk_text: (i) of a sum not exceeding rupees fifty thousand in the case of an agent in the business of collecting, forwarding or distributing goods carried by goods carriages;
title: Agent or canvasser or aggregator to obtain licence

chunk_text: (ii) of a sum not exceeding rupees five thousand in the case of any other agent or canvasser, and the circumstances under which the security may be forfeited;
title: Agent or canvasser or aggregator to obtain licence

chunk_text: (d) the provision by the agent of insurance of goods in transit;
title: Agent or canvasser or aggregator to obtain licence

chunk_text: (e) the authority by which and the circumstances under which the licence may be suspended or revoked;
title: Agent or canvasser or aggregator to obtain licence

chunk_text: (f) such other conditions as may be prescribed by the State Government.
title: Agent or canvasser or aggregator to obtain licence

chunk_text: (3) It shall be a condition of every licence that no agent or canvasser to whom the licence is granted shall advertise in any newspaper, book, list, classified directory or other publication unless there is contained in such advertisement appearing in such newspapers, book, list, classified directory or other publication the licence number, the date of expiry of licence and the particulars of the authority which granted the licence.
title: Agent or canvasser or aggregator to obtain licence

chunk_text: No Civil Court shall have jurisdiction to entertain any question relating to the grant of a permit 1[or licence issued under any scheme] under this Act, and no injunction in respect of any action taken or to be taken by the duly constituted authorities under this Act with regard to the grant of a permit 1[or licence issued under any scheme], shall be entertained by any Civil Court.
title: Bar on jurisdiction of Civil Courts

chunk_text: (1) A State Government may make rules to regulate, in respect of stage carriages and contract carriages and the conduct of passengers in such vehicles.
title: Power of State Government to make rules as to stage carriages and contract carriages

chunk_text: (2) Without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing provision, such rules may--
title: Power of State Government to make rules as to stage carriages and contract carriages

chunk_text: (a) authorise the removal from such vehicle of any person contravening the rules by the driver or conductor of the vehicle, or, on the request of the driver or conductor, or any passenger, by any police officer;
title: Power of State Government to make rules as to stage carriages and contract carriages

chunk_text: (b) require a passenger who is reasonably suspected by the driver or conductor of contravening the rules to give his name and address to a police officer or to the driver or conductor on demand;
title: Power of State Government to make rules as to stage carriages and contract carriages

chunk_text: (c) require a passenger to declare, if so demanded by the driver or conductor, the journey he intends to take or has taken in the vehicle and to pay the fare for the whole of such journey and to accept any ticket issued therefor;
title: Power of State Government to make rules as to stage carriages and contract carriages

chunk_text: (d) require, on demand being made for the purpose by the driver or conductor or other person authorised by the owners of the vehicle, production during the journey and surrender at the end of the journey by the holder thereof of any ticket issued to him;
title: Power of State Government to make rules as to stage carriages and contract carriages

chunk_text: (e) require a passenger, if so requested by the driver or conductor, to leave the vehicle on the completion of the journey the fare for which he has paid;
title: Power of State Government to make rules as to stage carriages and contract carriages

chunk_text: (f) require the surrender by the holder thereof on the expiry of the period for which it is issued of a ticket issued to him;
title: Power of State Government to make rules as to stage carriages and contract carriages

chunk_text: (g) require a passenger to abstain from doing anything which is likely to obstruct or interfere with the working of the vehicle or to cause damage to any part of the vehicle or its equipment or to cause injury or discomfort to any other passenger;
title: Power of State Government to make rules as to stage carriages and contract carriages

chunk_text: (h) require a passenger not to smoke in any vehicle on which a notice prohibiting smoking is exhibited;
title: Power of State Government to make rules as to stage carriages and contract carriages

chunk_text: (i) require the maintenance of complaint books in stage carriages and prescribe the conditions under which passengers can record any complaints in the same.
title: Power of State Government to make rules as to stage carriages and contract carriages

chunk_text: (1) A State Government may make rules for the purpose of carrying into effect the provisions of this Chapter.
title: Power of State Government to make rules for the purposes of this Chapter

chunk_text: (2) Without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing power, rules under this section may be made with respect to all or any of the following matters, namely:--
title: Power of State Government to make rules for the purposes of this Chapter

chunk_text: (i) the period of appointment and the terms of appointment of and the conduct of business by Regional and State Transport Authorities and the reports to be furnished by them;
title: Power of State Government to make rules for the purposes of this Chapter

chunk_text: (ii) the conduct of business by any such authority in the absence of any member (including the Chairman) thereof and the nature of business which, the circumstances under which and the manner in which, business could be so conducted;
title: Power of State Government to make rules for the purposes of this Chapter

chunk_text: (iii) the conduct and hearing of appeals that may be preferred under this Chapter, the fees to be paid in respect of such appeals and the refund of such fees;
title: Power of State Government to make rules for the purposes of this Chapter

chunk_text: (iv) the forms to be used for the purposes of this Chapter, including the forms of permits;
title: Power of State Government to make rules for the purposes of this Chapter

chunk_text: (v) the issue of copies of permits in place of permits lost, destroyed or multilated;
title: Power of State Government to make rules for the purposes of this Chapter

chunk_text: (vi) the documents, plates and marks to be carried by transport vehicles, the manner in which they are to be carried and the languages in which any such documents are to be expressed;
title: Power of State Government to make rules for the purposes of this Chapter

chunk_text: (vii) the fees to be paid in respect of applications for permits, duplicate permits and plates;
title: Power of State Government to make rules for the purposes of this Chapter

chunk_text: (vii) the exemption of prescribed persons or prescribed classes of persons from payment of all or any or any portion of the fees payable under this Chapter;
title: Power of State Government to make rules for the purposes of this Chapter

chunk_text: (ix) the custody, production and cancellation on revocation or expiration of permits, and the return of permits which have been cancelled;
title: Power of State Government to make rules for the purposes of this Chapter

chunk_text: (x) the conditions subject to which, and the extent to which, a permit granted in another State shall be valid in the State without countersignature;
title: Power of State Government to make rules for the purposes of this Chapter

chunk_text: (xi) the conditions subject to which, and the extent to which, a permit granted in one region shall be valid in another region within the State without countersignature;
title: Power of State Government to make rules for the purposes of this Chapter

chunk_text: (xii) the conditions to be attached to permits for the purpose of giving effect to any agreement such as is referred to in clause (iii) of sub-section (1) of section 67;
title: Power of State Government to make rules for the purposes of this Chapter

chunk_text: (xiii) the authorities to whom, the time within which and the manner in which appeals may be made;
title: Power of State Government to make rules for the purposes of this Chapter

chunk_text: (xiv) the construction and fittings of, and the equipment to be carried by, stage and contract carriage, whether generally or in specified areas;
title: Power of State Government to make rules for the purposes of this Chapter

chunk_text: (xv) the determination of the number of passengers a stage or contract carriage is adapted to carry and the number which may be carried;
title: Power of State Government to make rules for the purposes of this Chapter

chunk_text: (xvi) the conditions subject to which goods may be carried on stage and contract carriages partly or wholly in lieu of passengers;
title: Power of State Government to make rules for the purposes of this Chapter

chunk_text: (xvii) the safe custody and disposal of property left in a stage or contract carriage;
title: Power of State Government to make rules for the purposes of this Chapter

chunk_text: (xviii) regulating the painting or marking of transport vehicles and the display of advertising matter thereon, and in particular prohibiting the painting or marking of transport vehicles in such colour or manner as to induce any person to believe that the vehicle is used for the transport of mails;
title: Power of State Government to make rules for the purposes of this Chapter

chunk_text: (xix) the conveyance in stage or contract carriages of corpses or persons suffering from any infectious or contagious disease or goods likely to cause discomfort or injury to passengers and the inspection and disinfection of such carriage; if used for such purposes;
title: Power of State Government to make rules for the purposes of this Chapter

chunk_text: (xx) the provision of taxi meters on motor cabs requiring approval or standard types of taxi meters to be used and examining testing and sealing taxi meters;
title: Power of State Government to make rules for the purposes of this Chapter

chunk_text: (xxi) prohibiting the picking up or setting down of passengers by stage or contract carriages at specified places or in specified areas or at places other than duly notified stands or halting places and requiring the driver of a stage carriage to stop and remain stationary for a reasonable time when so required by a passenger desiring to board or alight from the vehicle at a notified halting place;
title: Power of State Government to make rules for the purposes of this Chapter

chunk_text: (xxii) the requirements which shall be complied with in the construction or use of any duly notified stand or halting place, including the provision of adequate equipment and facilities for the convenience of all users thereof; the fees, if any, which may be charged for the use of such facilities, the records which shall be maintained at such stands or places, the staff to be employed thereat, and the duties and conduct of such staff, and generally for maintaining such stands and places in a serviceable and clean condition;
title: Power of State Government to make rules for the purposes of this Chapter

chunk_text: (xxiii) the regulation of motor cab ranks;
title: Power of State Government to make rules for the purposes of this Chapter

chunk_text: (xxiv) requiring the owners of transport vehicles to notify any change of address or to report the failure of or damage to any vehicle used for the conveyance of passengers for hire or reward;
title: Power of State Government to make rules for the purposes of this Chapter

chunk_text: (xxv) authorising specified persons to enter at all reasonable times and inspect all premises used by permit holders for the purposes of their business;
title: Power of State Government to make rules for the purposes of this Chapter

chunk_text: (xxvi) requiring the person in charge of a stage carriage to carry any person tendering the legal or customary fare;
title: Power of State Government to make rules for the purposes of this Chapter

chunk_text: (xxvii) the conditions under which and the types of containers or vehicles in which animals or birds may be carried and the seasons during which animals or birds may or may not be carried;
title: Power of State Government to make rules for the purposes of this Chapter

chunk_text: (xxviii) the licensing of and the regulation of the conduct of agents or canvassers who engage in the sale of tickets for travel by public service vehicles or otherwise solicit custom for such vehicles;
title: Power of State Government to make rules for the purposes of this Chapter

chunk_text: (xxix) the licensing of agents engaged in the business of collecting for forwarding and distributing goods carried by goods carriages;
title: Power of State Government to make rules for the purposes of this Chapter

chunk_text: (xxx) the inspection of transport vehicles and their contents and of the permits relating to them;
title: Power of State Government to make rules for the purposes of this Chapter

chunk_text: (xxxi) the carriage of persons other than the driver in goods carriages;
title: Power of State Government to make rules for the purposes of this Chapter

chunk_text: (xxxii) the records to be maintained and the returns to be furnished by the owners of transport vehicles; and
title: Power of State Government to make rules for the purposes of this Chapter

chunk_text: 1[(xxxiia) framing of schemes under sub-section (3) of section 67;
title: Power of State Government to make rules for the purposes of this Chapter

chunk_text: (xxxiib) the promotion of effective competition, passenger convenience and safety, competitive fares and prevention of overcrowding;]
title: Power of State Government to make rules for the purposes of this Chapter

chunk_text: (xxxiii) any other matter which is to be or may be prescribed.
title: Power of State Government to make rules for the purposes of this Chapter

chunk_text: In this Chapter, unless the context otherwise requires, "road transport service" means a service of motor vehicles carrying passengers or goods or both by road for hire or reward.
title: Definition

chunk_text: The provisions of this Chapter and the rules and orders made thereunder shall have effect notwithstanding anything inconsistent therewith contained in Chapter V or in any other law for the time being in force or in any instrument having effect by virtue of any such law.
title: Chapter to override Chapter V and other laws

chunk_text: 1 [(1)] Where any State Government is of opinion that for the purpose of providing an efficient, adequate, economical and properly co-ordinated road transport service, it is necessary in the public interest that road transport services in general or any particular class of such service in relation to any area or route or portion thereof should be run and operated by the State transport undertaking, whether to the exclusion, complete or partial, of other persons or otherwise, the State Government may formulate a proposal regarding a scheme giving particulars of the nature of the services proposed to be rendered, the area or route proposed to be covered and other relevant particulars respecting thereto and shall publish such proposal in the Official Gazette of the State formulating such proposal and in not less than one newspaper in the regional language circulating in the area or route proposed to be covered by such scheme and also in such other manner as the State Government formulating such proposal deem fit.
title: Preparation and publication of proposal regarding road transport service of a State transport undertaking

chunk_text: 2 [(2) Notwithstanding anything contained in sub-section (1), when a proposal is published under that sub-section, then from the date of publication of such proposal, no permit shall be granted to any person, except a temporary permit during the pendency of the proposal and such temporary permit shall be valid only for a period of one year from the date of its issue of till the date of final publication of the scheme under section 100, whichever is earlier.]
title: Preparation and publication of proposal regarding road transport service of a State transport undertaking

chunk_text: (1) On the publication of any proposal regarding a scheme in the Official Gazette and in not less than one newspaper in the regional language circulating in the area or route which is to be covered by such proposal any person may, within thirty days from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette, file objections to it before the State Government.
title: Objection to the proposal

chunk_text: (2) The State Government may, after considering the objections and after giving an opportunity to the objector or his representatives and the representatives of the State transport undertaking to be heard in the matter, if they so desire, approve or modify such proposal.
title: Objection to the proposal

chunk_text: (3) The scheme relating to the proposal as approved or modified under sub-section (2) shall then be published in the Official Gazette by the State Government making such scheme and in not less than one newspaper in the regional language circulating in the area or route covered by such scheme and the same shall thereupon become final on the date of its publication in the Official Gazette and shall be called the approved scheme and the area or route to which it relates shall be called the notified area or notified route:
title: Objection to the proposal

chunk_text: Provided that no such scheme which relates to any inter-State route shall be deemed to be an approved scheme unless it has the previous approval of the Central Government.
title: Objection to the proposal

chunk_text: (4) Notwithstanding anything contained in this section, where a scheme is not published as an approved scheme under sub-section (3) in the Official Gazette within a period of one year from the date of publication of the proposal regarding the scheme in the Official Gazette under sub-section (1), the proposal shall be deemed to have lapsed.
title: Objection to the proposal

chunk_text: Explanation.--In computing the period of one year referred to in this sub-section, any period or periods during which the publication of the approved scheme under sub-section (3) was held up on account of any stay or injunction by the order of any court shall be excluded.
title: Objection to the proposal

chunk_text: Notwithstanding anything contained in section 87, a State transport undertaking may, in the public interest operate additional services for the conveyance of the passengers on special occasions such as to and from fairs and religious gatherings:
title: Operation of additional services by a State transport undertaking in certain circumstances

chunk_text: Provided that the State transport undertaking shall inform about the operation of such additional services to the concerned Transport Authority without delay.
title: Operation of additional services by a State transport undertaking in certain circumstances

chunk_text: (1) The State Government may, at any time, if it considers necessary, in the public interest so to do, modify any approved scheme after giving--
title: Cancellation or modification of scheme

chunk_text: (i) the State transport undertaking; and
title: Cancellation or modification of scheme

chunk_text: (ii) any other person who, in the opinion of the State Government, is likely to be affected by the proposed modification,
title: Cancellation or modification of scheme

chunk_text: an opportunity of being heard in respect of the proposed modification.
title: Cancellation or modification of scheme

chunk_text: (2) The State Government shall publish any modification proposed under sub-section (1) in the Official Gazette and in one of the newspapers in the regional languages circulating in the area in which it is proposed to be covered by such modification, together with the date, not being less than thirty days from such publication in the Official Gazette, and the time and place at which any representation received in this behalf will be heard by the State Government.
title: Cancellation or modification of scheme

chunk_text: (1) Where, in pursuance of an approved scheme, any State transport undertaking applies in such manner as may be prescribed by the State Government in this behalf for a stage carriage permit or a goods carriage permit or a contract carriage permit in respect of a notified area or notified route, the State Transport Authority in any case where the said area or route lies in more than one region and the Regional Transport Authority in any other case shall issue such permit to the State transport undertaking, notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained in Chapter V.
title: Issue of permits to State transport undertakings

chunk_text: (2) For the purpose of giving effect to the approved scheme in respect of a notified area or notified route, the State Transport Authority or, as the case may be, the Regional Transport Authority concerned may, by order,--
title: Issue of permits to State transport undertakings

chunk_text: (a) refuse to entertain any application for the grant or renewal of any other permit or reject any such application as may be pending;
title: Issue of permits to State transport undertakings

chunk_text: (b) cancel any existing permit;
title: Issue of permits to State transport undertakings

chunk_text: (c) modify the terms of any existing permit so as to--
title: Issue of permits to State transport undertakings

chunk_text: (i) render the permit ineffective beyond a specified date;
title: Issue of permits to State transport undertakings

chunk_text: (ii) reduce the number of vehicles authorised to be used under the permit;
title: Issue of permits to State transport undertakings

chunk_text: (iii) curtail the area or route covered by the permit in so far as such permit relates to the notified area or notified route.
title: Issue of permits to State transport undertakings

chunk_text: (3) For the removal of doubts, it is hereby declared that no appeal shall lie against any action taken, or order passed, by the State Transport Authority or any Regional Transport Authority under sub-section (1) or sub-section (2).
title: Issue of permits to State transport undertakings

chunk_text: STATE AMENDMENTS
title: Issue of permits to State transport undertakings

chunk_text: Karnataka--
title: Issue of permits to State transport undertakings

chunk_text: Amendment of section 103.--In section 103 of the Motor Vehicles Act, 1988 (Central Act 59 of 1988), after sub-section (1), the following shall be inserted, namely:--
title: Issue of permits to State transport undertakings

chunk_text: "(1A) It shall be lawful for the State Transport undertaking to operate on any route as stage carriage under any permit issued therefor to such undertaking under sub-section (1), any vehicle placed at the disposal and under the control of such undertaking by the owner of such vehicle under any arrangement entered into between such owner and the undertaking for the use of the said vehicle by the undertaking.]
title: Issue of permits to State transport undertakings

chunk_text: [Vide Karnataka Act 11 of 1996, sec. 2].
title: Issue of permits to State transport undertakings

chunk_text: Where a scheme has been published under sub-section (3) of section 100 in respect of any notified area or notified route, the State Transport Authority or the Regional Transport Authority, as the case may be, shall not grant any permit except in accordance with the provisions of the scheme:
title: Restriction on grant of permits in respect of a notified area or notified route

chunk_text: Provided that where no application for a permit has been made by the State transport undertaking in respect of any notified area or notified route in pursuance of an approved scheme, the State Transport Authority or the Regional Transport Authority, as the case may be, may grant temporary permits to any person in respect of such notified area or notified route subject to the condition that such permit shall cease to be effective on the issue of a permit to the State transport undertaking in respect of that area or route.
title: Restriction on grant of permits in respect of a notified area or notified route

chunk_text: (1) Where, in exercise of the powers conferred by clause (b) or clause (c) of sub-section (2) of section 103, any existing permit is cancelled or the terms thereof are modified, there shall be paid by the State transport undertaking to the holder of the permit, compensation, the amount of which shall be determined in accordance with the provisions of sub-section (4) or sub-section (5), as the case may be.
title: Principles and method of determining compensation and payment thereof

chunk_text: (2) Notwithstanding anything contained in sub-section (1), no compensation shall be payable on account of the cancellation of any existing permit or any modification of the terms thereof, when a permit for an alternative route or area in lieu thereof has been offered by the State Transport Authority or the Regional Transport Authority, as the case may be and accepted by the holder of the permit.
title: Principles and method of determining compensation and payment thereof

chunk_text: (3) For the removal of doubts, it is hereby declared that no compensation shall be payable on account of the refusal to renew a permit under clause (a) of sub-section (2) of section 103.
title: Principles and method of determining compensation and payment thereof

chunk_text: (4) Where, in exercise of the powers conferred by clause (b) or sub-clause (i) or sub-clause (ii) of clause (c) of sub-section (2) of section 103, any existing permit is cancelled or the terms thereof are modified so as to prevent the holder of the permit from using any vehicle authorised to be used thereunder for the full period from which the permit, would otherwise have been effective, the compensation payable to the holder of the permit for each vehicle affected by such cancellation or modification shall be computed as follows:--
title: Principles and method of determining compensation and payment thereof

chunk_text: (a) for every complete month or part of a month exceeding fifteen days of the unexpired period of the permit Two hundred rupees;
title: Principles and method of determining compensation and payment thereof

chunk_text: (b) for part of a month not exceeding fifteen days of the unexpired period of the permit One hundred rupees:
title: Principles and method of determining compensation and payment thereof

chunk_text: Provided that the amount of compensation shall, in no case, be less than four hundred rupees.
title: Principles and method of determining compensation and payment thereof

chunk_text: (5) Where, in exercise of the powers conferred by sub-clause (iii) of clause (c) of sub-section (2) of section 103, the terms of an existing permit are modified so as to curtail the area or route of any vehicle authorised to be used thereunder, the compensation payable to the holder of the permit on account of such curtailment shall be an amount computed in accordance with the following formula, namely:--
title: Principles and method of determining compensation and payment thereof

chunk_text: YA/ R
title: Principles and method of determining compensation and payment thereof

chunk_text: Explanation.--In this formula,--
title: Principles and method of determining compensation and payment thereof

chunk_text: (i) "Y" means the length or area by which the route or area covered by the permit is curtailed;
title: Principles and method of determining compensation and payment thereof

chunk_text: (ii) "A" means the amount computed in accordance with sub-section (4);
title: Principles and method of determining compensation and payment thereof

chunk_text: (iii) "R" means the total length of the route or the total area covered by the permit.
title: Principles and method of determining compensation and payment thereof

chunk_text: (6) The amount of compensation payable under this section shall be paid by the State transport undertaking to the person or persons entitled thereto within one month from the date on which the cancellation or modification of the permit becomes effective:
title: Principles and method of determining compensation and payment thereof

chunk_text: Provided that where the State transport undertaking fails to make the payment within the said period of one month, it shall pay interest at the rate of seven per cent. per annum from the date on which it falls due.
title: Principles and method of determining compensation and payment thereof

chunk_text: Where any article found in any transport vehicle operated by the State transport undertaking is not claimed by its owner within the prescribed period, the State transport undertaking may sell the article in the prescribed manner and the sale proceeds thereof, after deducting the costs incidental to sale, shall be paid to the owner on demand.
title: Disposal of article found in vehicles

chunk_text: (1) The State Government may make rules for the purpose of carrying into effect the provisions of this Chapter.
title: Power of State Government to make rules

chunk_text: (2) In particular and without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing power, such rules may provide for all or any of the following matters, namely:--
title: Power of State Government to make rules

chunk_text: (a) the form in which any proposal regarding a scheme may be published under section 99;
title: Power of State Government to make rules

chunk_text: (b) the manner in which objections may be filed under sub-section (1) of section 100;
title: Power of State Government to make rules

chunk_text: (c) the manner in which objections may be considered and disposed of under sub-section (2) of section 100;
title: Power of State Government to make rules

chunk_text: (d) the form in which any approved scheme may be published under sub-section (3) of section 100;
title: Power of State Government to make rules

chunk_text: (e) the manner in which application under sub-section (1) of section 103 may be made;
title: Power of State Government to make rules

chunk_text: (f) the period within which the owner may claim any article found left in any transport vehicle under section 106 and the manner of sale of such article;
title: Power of State Government to make rules

chunk_text: (g) the manner of service of orders under this Chapter;
title: Power of State Government to make rules

chunk_text: (h) any other matter which has to be, or may be, prescribed.
title: Power of State Government to make rules

chunk_text: The powers conferred on the State Government under this Chapter shall, in relation to a corporation or company owned or controlled by the Central Government or by the Central Government and one or more State Governments, be exercisable only by the Central Government in relation to an inter-State route or area.
title: Certain powers of State Government exercisable by the Central Government

chunk_text: (1) Every motor vehicle shall be so constructed and so maintained as to be at all times under the effective control of the person driving the vehicle.
title: General provision regarding construction and maintenance of vehicles

chunk_text: (2) Every motor vehicle shall be so constructed as to have right hand steering control unless it is equipped with a mechanical or electrical signalling device of a prescribed nature.
title: General provision regarding construction and maintenance of vehicles

chunk_text: 1 [(3) If the Central Government is of the opinion that it is necessary or expedient so to do in the public interest, it may by order published in the Official Gazette, notify that any article or process used by a manufacturer shall conform to such standard as may be specified in that order.]
title: General provision regarding construction and maintenance of vehicles

chunk_text:

regulating the construction, equipment and maintenance of motor vehicles and trailers with respect to all

of date and year of manufacture and the maximum load carrying capacity;]

chunk_text:
Provided that any rules relating to the matters dealing with the protection of environment, so far as
may be, shall be made after consultation with the Ministry of the Government of India dealing with
environment.
title: Power of Central Government to make rules

(2) Rules may be made under sub-section (1) governing the matters mentioned therein, including the
manner of ensuring the compliance with such matters and the maintenance of motor vehicles in respect of
such matters, either generally in respect of motor vehicles or trailers or in respect of motor vehicles or
trailers of a particular class or in particular circumstances 2[and such rules may lay down the procedure
for investigation, the officers empowered to conduct such investigations, the procedure for hearing of

title: Power of Central Government to make rules

chunk_text: (3) Notwithstanding anything contained in this section,--
title: Power of Central Government to make rules

(a) the Central Government may exempt any class of motor vehicles from the provisions of this

title: Power of Central Government to make rules

(b) a State Government may exempt any motor vehicle or any class or description of motor
vehicles from the rules made under sub-section (1) subject to such conditions as may be prescribed by
